Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin wonttetta gallassi Abrahaami guuran denddidi, ba hariyaa caaniis; ba ashkkaratuppe naa77aanne ba na7aa Yisaaqa banaara ekkidi, xuuggiyo yarshshuwaayyo gidiya mittaa qeri ekkidi, Xoossai ayyo yootidosaa baanau denddiis.

English Sentences: And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood: but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?
Wolaitta Sentences: Biiddi heezzantta gallassi Abrahaami xoqqu giidi, he sohuwaa haahuwan be7iis.

English Sentences: And Abraham said, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering: so they went both of them together.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami ba ashkkarata, "Ha hariyaara hagan de7ishshite; taaninne ta na7ai yaa biidi Xoossaassi goinnidi, inttekko simmana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they came to the place which God had told him of; and Abraham built an altar there, and laid the wood in order, and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar upon the wood.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami yarshshuwaa mittaa denttidi, ba na7aa Yisaaqa toossiis; toossidi tamaanne billamaa i baayyo oiqqiis. Eti naa77ai issippe biishin,

English Sentences: And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his son.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi ba aawaa Abrahaama, "Ta aawau" yaagiis. Yaagin Abrahaami, "Yee, ta na7au" yaagiis. Yaagin i, "Tamainne mittai hageeho; shin xuuggidi yarshshiyo dorssa mari awaanee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the angel of the LORD called unto him out of heaven, and said, Abraham, Abraham: and he said, Here am I.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Abrahaami, "Ta na7au, xuuggidi yarshshiyo dorssa maraa Xoossai baayyo immana" yaagiis. Yaanin eti naa77ai issippe biidosona.

English Sentences: And he said, Lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing thou hast not withheld thy son, thine only son from me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Xoossai ayyo yootido sohuwaa gakkido wode, Abrahaami yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaa yan gimbbidi, mittaa dacaa yeggiis; ba na7aa Yisaaqa qachchidi, he mittaa bollan zin77issiis.

English Sentences: And Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns: and Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zin77issidi Abrahaami ba na7aa shukkanau ba kushiyaa yeddidi billamaa ekkiis.

English Sentences: And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovahjireh: as it is said to this day, In the mount of the LORD it shall be seen.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin GODAA kiitanchchai saluwaappe a, "Abrahaamaa, Abrahaamaa" yaagidi xeesiis. Xeesin i, "Yee" giidi koyiis.

English Sentences: And the angel of the LORD called unto Abraham out of heaven the second time,
Wolaitta Sentences: Koyin a, "Na7aa bollan ne kushiyaa wottoppa; a ainne oottoppa; neeni ne mexi issi na7aakka tana diggabeenna gishshau, neeni Xoossau yayyiyaagaa gidiyoogaa taani ha77i erais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And said, By myself have I sworn, saith the LORD, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thine only son:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Abrahaami xoqqu gi xeellidi, hegan dorssa issoi kacee buuran geli qaxetti uttidoogaa be7iis. Abrahaami biidi he dorssaa ekkidi, ba na7aa gishshaa xuuggiyo yarshsho oottidi yarshshi bayiis.

English Sentences: That in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Abrahaami, "GODAI immana" yaagidi he sohuwaa sunttiis; hachchi gakkanaashinkka haisee, "GODAA deriyan imettana" geetettees.

English Sentences: And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA kiitanchchai saluwaappe naa77anttidi Abrahaama xeesidi yaagiis;

English Sentences: So Abraham returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba; and Abraham dwelt at Beersheba.
Wolaitta Sentences: "GODAI, Hagaadan yaagada neeyyo taani ta huuphiyan caaqqais; neeni hagaa oottido gishshaunne ne mexi issi na7aakka tana diggabeenna gishshau,

English Sentences: And it came to pass after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, Behold, Milcah, she hath also born children unto thy brother Nahor;
Wolaitta Sentences: taani nena tumu anjjana; ne zerettaakka taani saluwaa xoolinttiyaa keenanne abbaa doona shafiyaa keeni oottada corayana. Ne zerettati bantta morkketu katamata laattana.

English Sentences: Huz his firstborn, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni taayyo azazettido gishshau, ha sa7aa kawotettati ubbai ne zerettaa baggaara anjjettana yaagees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Chesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Jidlaph, and Bethuel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Abrahaami ba ashkkaratukko simmin, eti ubbai issippe Berssaabeha denddidi biidosona. Abrahaami Berssaabehan de7iis.

English Sentences: And Bethuel begat Rebekah: these eight Milcah did bear to Nahor, Abraham's brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe simmin Abrahaamassi, "Milkka ne ishaa Naakoorayyo naata yelaasu;

English Sentences: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash, and Maachah.
Wolaitta Sentences: etinne bairai Uuxa; Uuxa ishati Buuza,

English Sentences: And Sarah was an hundred and seven and twenty years old: these were the years of the life of Sarah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Araama aawaa Qamu7eela, Keesada, Haazo, Pilddaasha, Yidilaafanne Baatu7eela.

English Sentences: And Sarah died in Kirjatharba; the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan: and Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hageeta ha hosppun naatakka Milkka Abrahaama ishaa Naakoorayyo yelaasu; Baatu7eeli Ribiqo yeliis.

English Sentences: And Abraham stood up from before his dead, and spake unto the sons of Heth, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Raa7uma giyo a kaadumatiyaa qassi Xebaaha, Gahaama, Tahaashanne Maa7ika yelaasu" yaagidi yootidosona.

English Sentences: I am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saara xeetanne laatamanne laappun laitta de7aasu.

English Sentences: And the children of Heth answered Abraham, saying unto him,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan a Kanaane biittan de7iya Kebroona giyo Qiriyaati-Arbba7a kataman haiqqaasu. Haiqqin Abrahaami Saariyyo yeekkanaunne kayyottanau biis.

English Sentences: Hear us, my lord: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yeekki simmidi, Abrahaami ba keettaayee ahaa matappe denddidi biidi, Hiiteta hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: And Abraham stood up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani intte giddon betenne imatta; ta keettaayee ahaa mooganau taayyo intte gadiyaappe makkaanaa baizzerkketii!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he communed with them, saying, If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and intreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Hiiteti ayyo, "Godoo, nuuni yootiyoogaa siya;

English Sentences: That he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he shall give it me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you.
Wolaitta Sentences: neeni nu giddon wolqqaama halaqa; neeni ne keettaayee ahaa nu duufuwaappe nena lo77idaagan mooga; neeni ne keettaayee ahaa mooganau ba duufuwaa ooninne nena diggenna" yaagi zaaridosona.

English Sentences: And Ephron dwelt among the children of Heth: and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the audience of the children of Heth, even of all that went in at the gate of his city, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Abrahaami denddi eqqidi, Hiitetu sinttan ziggiis.

English Sentences: Nay, my lord, hear me: the field give I thee, and the cave that is therein, I give it thee; in the presence of the sons of my people give I it thee: bury thy dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: I etayyo, "Intte tana, Ne keettaayee ahaa mooga giikko siyite;

English Sentences: And Abraham bowed down himself before the people of the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoohaara na7aa Efiroonayyo a gadiyaa gaxan de7iya Maakipheela giyo gonggoluwaa taayyo makkaana kessanau baizzana mala kumetta waagan nuna zal77isserkketii" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he spake unto Ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, But if thou wilt give it, I pray thee, hear me: I will give thee money for the field; take it of me, and I will bury my dead there.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiitiyaa Efirooni he wode katamaa penggen shiiqida ba asaa giddon uttiis; uttidaagee Hiiteti ubbai siyishin, Abrahaamayyo yaagiis;

English Sentences: And Ephron answered Abraham, saying unto him,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaadan gidenna; ta godau, ta yootiyoogaa siya; taani gadiyaakka a giddon de7iya gonggoluwaakka neeyyo immais; taani neeyyo a ta asaa sinttan immais; neeni ne keettaayee ahaa mooga" yaagiis.

English Sentences: My lord, hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver; what is that betwixt me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Abrahaami he biittaa asaa sinttan zaaretti ziggidi,

English Sentences: And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver, which he had named in the audience of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.
Wolaitta Sentences: asai siyishin Efiroona, "Ta yootiyoogaa siyarkkii! Taani he gadiyaa waagaa qanxxana; neeni taappe ekkarkkii! Hegan taani ta keettaayee ahaa moogana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the borders round about, were made sure
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Efirooni Abrahaamayyo zaaridi, "Ta godau, taani odiyoogaa siya;

English Sentences: Unto Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all that went in at the gate of his city.
Wolaitta Sentences: gadee oiddu xeetu xaqara biraa kessiyaagaa; shin hegee ne giddooninne ta giddoon ainne gidenna; ne keettaayee ahaa mooga" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre: the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Abrahaami Hiiteti siyishin, Efirooni giido waagaa maayiis; maayidi, he wode miishshan oiddu xeetu xaqara biraa Efiroonayyo immiis.

English Sentences: And the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto Abraham for a possession of a buryingplace by the sons of Heth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Immin Mamire katamaa matan Maakipheelan de7iya Efiroona gadee, hegan de7iya gonggoloinne he gadiyan de7iya mitta ubbai,

English Sentences: And Abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
Wolaitta Sentences: katamaa penggen shiiqida Hiitetu ubbaa sinttan higgiyan Abrahaama gade gidiis.

English Sentences: And Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Abrahaami ba keettaayyiyo Saaro Kanaane biittan Kebroona giyo Mamire katamaa matan de7iya Maakipheela giyo gade gonggoluwan moogiis.

English Sentences: And I will make thee swear by the LORD, the God of heaven, and the God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau he gadeenne hegan de7iya gonggoloi Hiitetu sinttan higgiyan Abrahaamassi makkaana gidiis.

English Sentences: But thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son Isaac.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami keehippe sa7aa sugidi cimiis; GODAI a ubbabankka anjjiis.

English Sentences: And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must I needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest?
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami ba ashkkaraa, ba so asa ubbau halaqatiya, ba aqo ubbau godattiyaagaa hagaadan yaagiis; "Ne kushiyan ta gulbbataa oiqqa;

English Sentences: And Abraham said unto him, Beware thou that thou bring not my son thither again.
Wolaitta Sentences: taani eta giddon de7iyo Kanaanetu macca naatuppe ta na7aayyo machcho oichchenna mala, GODAN, saluwaa Xoossaaninne sa7aa Xoossan taani nena caaqettais;

English Sentences: The LORD God of heaven, which took me from my father's house, and from the land of my kindred, and which spake unto me, and that sware unto me, saying, Unto thy seed will I give this land; he shall send his angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from thence.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin neeni ta yelettido biittaa, ta dabbotukko baada, ta na7aa Yisaaqayyo machcho oichcha" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath: only bring not my son thither again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin a ashkkarai, "Maccaasiyaa tanaara yaanau dosennabaa gidikko, ne na7aa neeni yiido biitti guyye efoo?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and sware to him concerning that matter.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Abrahaami, "Ta na7aa yaa efeennaadan nena era!

English Sentences: And the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master were in his hand: and he arose, and went to Mesopotamia, unto the city of Nahor.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI, saluwaa Xoossai, tana ta aawaa sooppenne ta yelettido biittaappe kessidaagee taayyo, Ne zariyaayyo taani ha biittaa immana yaagidi caaqqidaagee, neeni ta na7aayyo yaappe machcho demmana mala, i ba kiitanchchaa neeppe sinttau kiittana.

English Sentences: And he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out to draw water.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maccaasiyaa nenaara guyye yaanau dosennabaa gidikko, ha taani nena caaqettido caaqoi neeyyo gometenna; shin ta na7aa yaa guyye mulekka efooppa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, I pray thee, send me good speed this day, and shew kindness unto my master Abraham.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin ashkkarai ba godaa Abrahaama gulbbataa oiqqiis; oiqqidi ha yohuwaassi caaqqiis.

English Sentences: Behold, I stand here by the well of water; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, ashkkarai ba godaa gaameelatuppe tammaa ekkidi, ba godaa miishshaappekka murutaa murutaa ekkidi biis; biidi Masphphexoomiyaa giyo biittan Naakoora katamaa gakkiis.

English Sentences: And let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac; and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gakkidi omarssi, maccaasai haattaa tikkanau yiyo wodiyan, katamaappe gaxan haatta ollaa matan ba gaameelata gulbbatissiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi i hagaadan yaagidi woossiis; "GODAU, ta godaa Abrahaama Xoossau, hachchi taani qoppada yiidobaa tau injjeya; qassi ta godaa Abrahaamayyo kehabaa ootta.

English Sentences: And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7a! Taani ha haattaa pulttuwaa matan eqqais; ha katamaa asaa macca naatinne haattaa tikkanau haa yoosona.

English Sentences: And the servant ran to meet her, and said, Let me, I pray thee, drink a little water of thy pitcher.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Ane otuwaa ziqqi oottada tana haattaa ushsha giyo wode, akka, Hekko uya; qassi ne gaameelatakka taani ushshana yaagiyaara, hinna ne ashkkaraa Yisaaqayyo neeni dooridooro gidu; neeni ta godaayyo kehabaa oottidoogaa taani hegan erana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And she said, Drink, my lord: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biron i woosaa zaarennan de7ishin, Ribiqa haatta otuwaa tookkada puttu gaasu. O Baatu7eeli yeliis; Baatu7eeli Milkki na7aa; Milkka Abrahaama ishaa Naakoora keettaayyiyo.

English Sentences: And when she had done giving him drink, she said, I will draw water for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ribiqa keehi puulanchchanne attuma asi xalibeenna geela7o. Pulttuwaa duge wodhdhada, ba otuwaa kunttada kiyaasu.

English Sentences: And she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiyin he ashkkarai ikko woxxi biidi o, "Ne otuwaappe tana guutta haattaa ushsharkkii!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin a, "Eeno ta godau, uyikkii" yaagaasu. Eesotada otuwaa ba hashiyaappe wottada, geddi ootta oiqqada a ushshaasu.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;
Wolaitta Sentences: A ushshidoogaappe guyyiyan, "Ne gaameelatikka alana gakkanaassi taani etayyo haattaa duuqqana" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And said, Whose daughter art thou? tell me, I pray thee: is there room in thy father's house for us to lodge in?
Wolaitta Sentences: Attida haattaa eesuwan wonggiriyan tigada, hara haattaa duuqqanau ollaa woxxaasu; gaameelati ubbai alana gakkanaashin, haattaa ollaappe duuqqa duuqqada ehaada wonggiriyan tigada ushshaasu.

English Sentences: And she said unto him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, which she bare unto Nahor.
Wolaitta Sentences: I qoppidi yiido qofaa GODAI injjeyiiddi de7iyaakkonne eranau bitanee co77u giidi o xeellees.

English Sentences: She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gaameelati haattaa uyi simmin, bitanee ichchashu giraame bagga gidiya worqqa qalabatiyaanne, xeetanne tammu giraame gidiya naa77u worqqa sagaayota kessiis;

English Sentences: And the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: kessidi o, "Neeni o na7ee? Ane tau yoota; ne aawaa son nuuyyo aqiyoosi de7anee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of my master Abraham, who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: I being in the way, the LORD led me to the house of my master's brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin a, "Taani Baatu7eela na7iyo; Baatu7eeli Milkka Naakoorayyo yelido na7aa.

English Sentences: And the damsel ran, and told them of her mother's house these things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuugan gidiya galabainne bassoi de7ees; qassi intte aqanaukka sohoi de7ees" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban: and Laban ran out unto the man, unto the well.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bitanee gulbbati GODAAYYO goinnidi,

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.
Wolaitta Sentences: hagaadan yaagiis; "Ta godaayyo kehiyoogaanne ammanettiyoogaa aggibeenna GODAI, ta godaa Abrahaama Xoossai galatetto! Taani yiishin, GODAI tana ta godaa dabbotu soo kaalettiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Come in, thou blessed of the LORD; wherefore standest thou without? for I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7iyaa woxxa baada, ba aayee son de7iya asaassi hanidabaa odaasu.

English Sentences: And the man came into the house: and he ungirded his camels, and gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ribiqeeyyo Laabaana giyo ishai de7ees; Laabaani kare kiyidi, haattaa pulttuwaa matan de7iya bitaniyaakko woxxiis.

English Sentences: And there was set meat before him to eat: but he said, I will not eat, until I have told mine errand. And he said, Speak on.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qalabatiyaanne ba michchee kushiyan de7iya sagaayota be7osaaranne Ribiqa bitanee bana giidobaa yootin siyosaara, kiyidi bitaniyaakko bi be7iis; bitanee gaameelatuura pulttuwaa matan eqqidaagaa demmiis.

English Sentences: And he said, I am Abraham's servant.
Wolaitta Sentences: Demmidi a, "GODAI nena anjjidoogoo, haaya! Neeni hagan karen aissi eqqai? Taani neeyyo keettaanne gaameelatuyyookka sohuwaa giigissaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD hath blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold, and menservants, and maidservants, and camels, and asses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin bitanee soo geliis; Laabaani gaameelatu caanaa birshshiis; galabaanne bassuwaa gaameelatuyyo yeggiis. Tohuwaa meeccanau ayyoonne aara de7iya asatuyyo haattaa ehiis;

English Sentences: And Sarah my master's wife bare a son to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
Wolaitta Sentences: qumaikka a sintti aadhdhiis. SHin i, "Taani tana ehidabaa intteyyo yootennan de7aidda katta miikke" yaagiis. Yaagin Laabaani, "Yaakko yoota" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And my master made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau i, "Taani Abrahaama ashkkaraa.

English Sentences: But thou shalt go unto my father's house, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI ta godaa keehi anjjin, i duretiis; dorssaa, miizzaa, biraa, worqqaa, attuma ashkkarata, macca ashkkarata, gaameelatanne hareta ayyo immiis.

English Sentences: And I said unto my master, Peradventure the woman will not follow me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta godaa keettaayyiyaa Saara ba ceegatettaa laittan ayyo attuma na7a yelaasu; yelin i baayyo de7iyaabaa ubbaa ayyo immiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto me, The LORD, before whom I walk, will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father's house:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta godai tana hagaadan caaqettiis; Taani de7iyo Kanaane biittaa macca naatuppe ta na7aayyo machcho oichchoppa;

English Sentences: Then shalt thou be clear from this my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin ta aawaa asaakko, ta zaretukko baada, ta na7aayyo machcho oichcha yaagiis.

English Sentences: And I came this day unto the well, and said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which I go:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin taani ta godaa, Na7iyaa tanaara yaanau dosennan aggikko shin? yaagaas.

English Sentences: Behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw water, and I say to her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i, GODAI, taani a sinttan hemettidoogee nenaara ba kiitanchchaa kiittana; neeni ta na7aayyo ta aawaa asaappe, ta zaretuppe machcho demmana mala, ne biyoobaakka injjeyana.

English Sentences: And she say to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman whom the LORD hath appointed out for my master's son.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ta zaretukko bin, eti neeyyo o immennan ixxikko, he wode neeyyo caaqoi gometenna yaagiis.

English Sentences: And before I had done speaking in mine heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew water: and I said unto her, Let me drink, I pray thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani hachchi ha pulttuwaakko yiido wode yaagaas; GODAU, ta godaa Abrahaama Xoossau, ne shene gidikko, taani biyo yohuwaa injjeya.

English Sentences: And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: so I drank, and she made the camels drink also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7a; taani ha pulttuwaa matan eqqais; geela7o issinniyaa haattaa tikkanau yiikko, taani o, "Tana ne otuwaappe guutta haattaa ushsharkkii!" yaagana.

English Sentences: And I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bare unto him: and I put the earring upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin a tana, "Eeno uya; qassi ne gaameelatuyyookka taani haattaa duuqqana" yaagiyaara, GODAI ta godaa na7aayyo dooridooro gidu yaagaas.

English Sentences: And I bowed down my head, and worshipped the LORD, and blessed the LORD God of my master Abraham, which had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter unto his son.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta wozanan woossiyoogaa zaarennan de7ishin, Ribiqa ba otuwaa tookka ekkada, puttu gaasu; pulttuwaa duge wodhdhada haattaa duuqqaasu; taani o, Tana haattaa ushsharkkii yaagaas.

English Sentences: And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaagin a eesuwan ba hashiyaappe otuwaa wottada, Hekko uya; qassi taani ne gaameelata ushshana yaagaasu. Yaagin taani uyaas; qassi ta gaameelata a ushshaasu.

English Sentences: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, The thing proceedeth from the LORD: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani o, Neeni o na7ii? yaagaas. "Yaagin a, Taani Baatu7eela na7iyo; Baatu7eeli, Milkka Naakoorayyo yelido na7aa yaagaasu. "Yaagin taani iyyo qalabatiyaa aattaas; i kushiyankka sagaayota wottaas.

English Sentences: Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's son's wife, as the LORD hath spoken.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan taani gulbbatada, GODAAYYO goinnaas; taani GODAA, ta godaa Abrahaama Xoossaa, ta godaa ishaa na7aa na7iyo a na7aassi ekkanau tana likke ogiyaa kaalettidaagaa galatais.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that, when Abraham's servant heard their words, he worshipped the LORD, bowing himself to the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77ikka intte ta godaayyo kehanabaanne ammanettanabaa gidikko, taayyo yootite; gidana xayikkonne yootite; hegaappe sinttan taani hananabaa erana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laabaaninne Baatu7eeli zaaridi yaagidosona; "Ha yohoi GODAAPPE yiis; nuuni neeyyo yaa haa gaanau danddayokko.

English Sentences: And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away unto my master.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ribiqo hanno be7a; ekkada efa; efin GODAI giidoogaadan ne godaa na7aassi machcho gidubain" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And her brother and her mother said, Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaama ashkkarai eti giyoobaa siyido wode, sa7an gulbbatidi GODAAYYO goinniis.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing the LORD hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ashkkarai biraa alleequwaanne worqqaa alleequwaa, maayuwaakka kessidi, Ribiqiyyo immiis; qassi al77o miishshata i ishaayyoonne i aayeeyyo immiis.

English Sentences: And they said, We will call the damsel, and enquire at her mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, inne aara de7iyaageeti miidosonanne uyidosona; yaatidi yan aqidosona; eti guuran denddin, "Tana ta godaakko yeddite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they called Rebekah, and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said, I will go.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i ishainne i aayyiyaa, "Na7iyaa issi tammu gallassa keenaa nunaara takku; hegaappe guyyiyan a baana" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, and his men.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i, "GODAI taani yiidobaa injjeyirggin, intte tana gam77issoppite; taani ta godaakko baana mala tana moissite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, Thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the gate of those which hate them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin eti, "Na7iyo xeesidi ane o oichchoos" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagidi Ribiqo xeesidi, "Ha bitaniyaara buutee?" yaagidi oichchidosona. Oichchin a, "Ee; taani baana" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And Isaac came from the way of the well Lahairoi; for he dwelt in the south country.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanin eti bantta michchiyo Ribiqo, o dichchiyaariira, Abrahaama ashkkaraaranne a asatuura moissidosona.

English Sentences: And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the camels were coming.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Ribiqo, "Nu michchee Ribiqee, sha7aappe sha7aa gakkanau coratta. Ne zareti bantta morkketu katamata laattona" yaagidi anjjidosona.

English Sentences: And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she lighted off the camel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Ribiqanne i danggiriixeti denddidi, gaameelata toggidi, bitaniyaara biidosona. Yaatin ashkkarai Ribiqo ekkidi biis.

English Sentences: For she had said unto the servant, What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? And the servant had said, It is my master: therefore she took a vail, and covered herself.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Yisaaqi, "Tana Be7iya De7o Xoossaa Pulttuwaa" giyo pulttuwaa mati biidi, Neegeeba bazzuwan de7ees.

English Sentences: And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassi omarssi Yisaaqi ba wozanan qoppiiddi dembbaa kiyidi yuuyees; yuuyiiddi i xoqqu giidi xeelliyo wode, gaameelati yiyaageeta be7iis.

English Sentences: And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her: and Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ribiqakka xoqqu gaada xeelliyo wode, Yisaaqa be7aasu; be7ada gaameelaappe wodhdhaasu.

English Sentences: Then again Abraham took a wife, and her name was Keturah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wodhdhada ashkkaraa, "Ha nunaara gaittanau dembbaara yiya bitanee oonee?" yaagaasu. Yaagin ashkkarai, "I ta godaattennee" yaagiis. Yaagin a ba shaashiyaa ekkada gullettaasu.

English Sentences: And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi ashkkarai ba oottidobaa ubbaa Yisaaqassi yootiis.

English Sentences: And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi Ribiqo ba aayee Saari dunkkaaniyaa efiis. Efiidi o machchiis; akka ayyo machcho gidaasu. Yaatin i o siiqiisinne ba aayee haiquwan kayyottiyoogaappe minettiis.

English Sentences: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abidah, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Abrahaami Qaxuro geetettiya hara machchiyo ekkiis.

English Sentences: And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
Wolaitta Sentences: A Ziimiraana, Yoqishaana, Madaana, Midiyaama, Yishibaaqanne SHuha ayyo yelaasu.

English Sentences: But unto the sons of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yoqishaani Saabanne Dadaana yeliis. Dadaani Ashooreta, Lexuushetanne Le7aamata yeliis.

English Sentences: And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.
Wolaitta Sentences: Midiyaama naati Eefa, Efeera, Hanooka, Abiidaa7anne Elddaa7a. Hageeti ubbaikka Qaxuri naata.

English Sentences: Then Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami babaa ubbaa Yisaaqa laatissiis.

English Sentences: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i biron paxa de7iiddi, ba kaadumatatuppe yelido naatussi bau de7iyaabaappe woitiis. Woitidi ba na7aa Yisaaqappe eta shaakkidi, arshsho bagga biittau yeddiis.

English Sentences: The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami muleera issi xeetanne laappun tammanne ichchashu laittaa de7iis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt by the well Lahairoi.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami daro wodiyaa de7idi, lo77o ceeggidi haiqqiis; haiqqidi ba maizzan gaittiis.

English Sentences: Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bare unto Abraham:
Wolaitta Sentences: A naati Yisaaqinne Isimaa7eeli a Maakipheela giyo gonggolo duufuwan moogidosona; he gonggoloi Mamire matan, Hiitiyaa Xohaara na7aa Efiroona gadiyan de7ees.

English Sentences: And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebajoth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegeenne Abrahaami Hiitetuppe shammido gadiyaa. Abrahaami ba keettaayyiyaa Saara moogettidosan moogettiis.

English Sentences: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaami haiqqidoogaappe guyyiyan, Xoossai a na7aa Yisaaqa anjjiis. He wode Yisaaqi, "Tana Be7iya De7o Xoossaa Pulttuwaa" giyo pulttuwaa matan de7ees.

English Sentences: Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:
Wolaitta Sentences: Saari ailliyaa, Gibxxeppe yiida Aggaara, Abrahaamayyo yelido na7aa Isimaa7eela yeletai hagaappe kaallidi xaafettidaagaa.

English Sentences: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isimaa7eela naati bantta sunttaaninne bantta yeletaa maaran hageeta; heegeetinne: Nabaayoota, Qeedaara, Adibi7eela, Mibssaama,

English Sentences: And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the ghost and died; and was gathered unto his people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mishimaa7a, Duuma, Maasa,

English Sentences: And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur, that is before Egypt, as thou goest toward Assyria: and he died in the presence of all his brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hadaada, Teema, Yixura, Naafiishanne Qeedima.

English Sentences: And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham begat Isaac:
Wolaitta Sentences: Isimaa7eela naati hageeta; eta sunttai eta moottaaninne de7iyo man77iyan hagaa. Eti bantta yarankka tammanne naa77u halaqata.

English Sentences: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padanaram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isimaa7eeli muleera xeetanne hasttamanne laappun laittaa de7idi, haiqqiis; haiqqidi ba maizzan gaittiis.

English Sentences: And Isaac intreated the LORD for his wife, because she was barren: and the LORD was intreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isimaa7eela zareti Gibxxeppe awai mokkiyo baggan de7iya Hawiilappenne SHurappe gidduwan, Asoora efiya ogiyaa matan de7idosona. Eti bantta ishanttu ubbaara morkkiyan de7idosona.

English Sentences: And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If it be so, why am I thus? And she went to enquire of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abrahaama na7aa Yisaaqa yeletai hagaappe kaallidi xaafettidaagaa. Abrahaami Yisaaqa yeliis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqau laittai oitamaa gidido wode, Ribiqo ekkiis; a Masphphexoomiyan de7iya Sooriyaa Baatu7eela na7iyoonne Sooriyaa Laabaana michchiyo.

English Sentences: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi ba keettaayyiyaa maine gidido gishshau, iyyo GODAA woossiis; woossin GODAI a woosaa siyiis. Yaatin a keettaayyiyaa Ribiqa shahaaraasu.

English Sentences: And the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ulo giddon de7iya naati mentte gidi uttidi, issoi issuwaara sugettidosona; yaatin a, "Hagee tau aissi hanii?" yaagaasu. Hegaa gishshau GODAA oichchanau baasu.

English Sentences: And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau's heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bin GODAI iyyo, "Ne uluwan naa77u kawotettai de7ees; qassi ne giddon de7iya naa77u dere asati issoi issuwaappe shaahettana; issi dere asati hinkkootuppe minnana; qassi bairai kaaluwaayyo azazettana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents.
Wolaitta Sentences: A yeliyo wodee gakkin, i uluwan mentte attuma naati de7oosona.

English Sentences: And Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison: but Rebekah loved Jacob.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koiro yelettidaagee arssa; a bollaa ubbaa ikisee maayiis; hegaa gishshau eti a Eesawa giidi sunttidosona.

English Sentences: And Jacob sod pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he was faint:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, a ishai yelettiis; yelettiiddi i ba kushiyan Eesawa ginddiyaa oiqqi uttiis; hegaa gishshau a Yaaqooba giidi sunttidosona. Ribiqa eta yelido wode, Yisaaqau usuppun tammu laitta gidiis.

English Sentences: And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naati diccidosona; Eesawi shankkaa hiillaa eriya bazzo asa gidiis; shin Yaaqoobi dunkkaaniyan de7iya woppa asa gidiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob said, Sell me this day thy birthright.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi Eesawa siiqiis; aissi giikko, i shankkatidobaappe maanau dosiis; shin Ribiqa Yaaqooba siiqaasu.

English Sentences: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Issitoo Yaaqoobi woxiyaa kattishin, Eesawi namisai woridoogee, bazzoppe yiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eesawi Yaaqooba, "Tana ha zo7o woxiyaappe miza; tana namisai worees" yaagiis. Hegaa gishshau qassi a sunttai Eedooma geetettiis.

English Sentences: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus Esau despised his birthright.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi a, "Koiro taayyo ne bairatettaa baizza" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Eesawi, "Be7a! Taani haiqqana hanais; ha bairatettan tau ai go77i de7ii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yaaqoobi zaaridi, "Ane taayyo koiro neeni caaqqa" yaagiis. Yaagin i caaqqiis; ba bairatettaanne Yaaqoobau baizziis.

English Sentences: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I sware unto Abraham thy father;
Wolaitta Sentences: Baizzin Yaaqoobi Eesawassi buddeenaanne misiraa woxiyaa immiis; immin i miisinne uyiis; hegaappe guyyiyan denddidi biis. Eesawi ba bairatettaa hagaadan kariis.

English Sentences: And I will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed;
Wolaitta Sentences: He biittan kase Abrahaama wodiyan de7iya koshaa bolli hara koshai denddiis; yaatin Yisaaqi Pilisxxeema kawuwaa Abimelekakko Garaari biis.

English Sentences: Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Yisaaqayyo qonccidi hagaadan yaagiis; "Gibxxe biitti duge booppa; taani neeyyo yootido biittan de7a.

English Sentences: And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha biittan amaridaagaa takkashsha; taani nenaara gidana; nena anjjana; aissi giikko, ha biittaa ubbaa taani neeyyoonne ne zerettaayyo immana; taani ne aawaa Abrahaamayyo caaqqido caaquwaa minttana.

English Sentences: And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne zerettaa saluwaa xoolinttiyaadan darissana; ha biittaa ubbaa taani etayyo immana; sa7aa kawotetta ubbai ne zerettaa baggaara anjjettana.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Abrahaami ta qaalaa siyiis; ta pirddatanne ta azazota, ta awaajotanne ta higgeta naagiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, of a surety she is thy wife: and how saidst thou, She is my sister? And Isaac said unto him, Because I said, Lest I die for her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Yisaaqi Garaaran uttiis.

English Sentences: And Abimelech said, What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might lightly have lien with thy wife, and thou shouldest have brought guiltiness upon us.
Wolaitta Sentences: He biittaa asai Ribiqibaa denttidi Yisaaqa, "Hanna neeyyo aibee?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin i, "Hanna taayyo michchiyo" yaagiis. Aissi giikko, i Ribiqa daro meranchcha gidiyo gishshau, "Taani, A ta keettaayyiyo giikko, ha sohuwaa asai i gaasuwan tana woranaakkonne" yaagi qoppidi yayyiis.

English Sentences: And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi hegan daro wodiyaa de7idoogaappe guyyiyan, Pilisxxeema Kawoi Abimeleki maskkootiyaara duge xeellidi, Yisaaqi ba keettaayee Ribiqiira gaittishin be7iis.

English Sentences: Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and the LORD blessed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Abimeleki Yisaaqa xeesidi, "Hekko a tumu ne machchiyo! Neeni aissi, A ta michchiyo gaadii?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin Yisaaqi, "A ta keettaayyiyo giikko, i gaasuwan asai tana worana gaada gaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Abimeleki, "Hagee neeni nu bollan oottidobi aibee? Ta asaappe issi asi ne keettaayeera aqi haliis shin; neeni nu bollan gomiyaa eha haladasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: For he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and great store of servants: and the Philistines envied him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Abimeleki ba asaa ubbaa, "Ha bitaniyaa woikko a keettaayyiyo bochchiya ooninne tumu haiqqana" yaagidi azaziis.

English Sentences: For all the wells which his father's servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi he biittan kattaa zeridi, he laittankka xeetu kushiyaa cakkiis; aissi giikko, GODAI a anjjiis.

English Sentences: And Abimelech said unto Isaac, Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.
Wolaitta Sentences: I duretiis; i duriyaa mannana gakkanaassi ayyo aqoi dari dari biis.

English Sentences: And Isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqassi dorssaa wudee, miizzaa wudeenne ashkkarati keehippe darido gishshau, Pilisxxeema asati a qanaatidosona.

English Sentences: And Isaac digged again the wells of water, which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, a aawaa Abrahaama wodiyan, a aawaa ashkkarati bookkido haatta olla ubbaa Pilisxxeema asati biittaa zaaridi baridosona.

English Sentences: And Isaac's servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Abimeleki Yisaaqa, "Nuuppe shaahettada ba; neeni nuuppe aadhdhada minnadasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the herdmen of Gerar did strive with Isaac's herdmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek; because they strove with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yisaaqi hegaappe denddidi, Garaara Wombbaa biidi yan uttiis.

English Sentences: And they digged another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it Sitnah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi ba aawaa Abrahaama wodiyan bookettida haatta ollata, Abrahaami haiqqidoogaappe guyyiyan, Pilisxxeema asati baridoogeeta zaari bookki kessidi, a aawai sunttido sunttankka eta xeesiis.

English Sentences: And he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said, For now the LORD hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqa ashkkarati wombban bookkidi, pulttiya haatta ollaa yan demmidosona.

English Sentences: And he went up from thence to Beersheba.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Garaara henttanchchati Yisaaqa henttanchchatuura, "Haattai nuugaa" yaagidi ooyettidosona. Eti aara palamettido gishshau, Yisaaqi he haatta ollaa, "Palamaa" giidi sunttiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD appeared unto him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham thy father: fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abraham's sake.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, eti hara haatta ollaakka bookkidosona; shin eti he haattaa ollaa geedonkka ooyettidosona; hegaa gishshau i he haattaa ollaa "Morkketettaa" giidi sunttiis.

English Sentences: And he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of the LORD, and pitched his tent there: and there Isaac's servants digged a well.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guuttaa zardda7idi, hara haatta ollaa bookissiis; a gaasuwan ooninne ooyettibeenna; "Xoossai ha77i nuuyyo aassiis; nuuni ha biittan corattana" giidi a, "Aaho sohuwaa" giidi sunttiis.

English Sentences: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the chief captain of his army.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe denddidi, pude Berssaabehi biis.

English Sentences: And Isaac said unto them, Wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?
Wolaitta Sentences: He biido gallassi qammikka GODAI ayyo qonccidi a, "Taani ne aawaa Abrahaama Xoossaa; taani nenaara de7iyo gishshau, neeni yayyoppa; taani nena anjjana; ta ashkkaraa Abrahaama gishshau ne zerettaa taani corayana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they said, We saw certainly that the LORD was with thee: and we said, Let there be now an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yisaaqi hegan yarshshiyoosaa keexxidi, GODAA sunttaa xeesiis. Yan i ba dunkkaaniyaa toliis; qassi yan a ashkkarati haatta ollaa bookkidosona.

English Sentences: That thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Abimeleki bana zoriya Ahuuzatanne ba wotaaddaratu halaqaa Pikoola ekkidi, Garaarappe Yisaaqakko yiis.

English Sentences: And he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi eta, "Intte kase tana ixxidi, intte biittaappe kessi yeddooho; ha77i qassi taakko ai ekkana yiidetii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin eti a, "GODAI nenaara de7iyoogaa nuuni qoncciyan be7ida. Hegaa gishshau caaqo maachchai nu giddooninne ne giddon de7ana koshshees yaagoos. Nuuni nena bochchibookko;

English Sentences: And it came to pass the same day, that Isaac's servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, We have found water.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin nuuni neeyyo kehatetta xalaalaa oottidi, nena sarotettan moissi yeddida. Hegaadankka neeni nu bolli iitabaa oottenna mala, ane nenaara maachchaa maacettoos. Ha77i neeni GODAI anjjidoogaa" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he called it Shebah: therefore the name of the city is Beersheba unto this day.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Yisaaqi etau gibiraa giigissin, miidosonanne uyidosona.

English Sentences: And Esau was forty years old when he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi maallado guuran denddidi, eti issoi issuwaara caaqettidosona. Yisaaqi eta moissin, eti appe saro shaahettidi biidosona.

English Sentences: Which were a grief of mind unto Isaac and to Rebekah.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassi Yisaaqa ashkkarati yiidi, bantta bookkido haatta ollaabaa ayyo odidosona; "Nuuni haattaa demmida" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his eldest son, and said unto him, My son: and he said unto him, Behold, here am I.
Wolaitta Sentences: I he haatta ollaa Saabehi giidi sunttiis; hegaa gishshau he katamaa sunttai hachchi gakkanaassi Berssaabehi geetettees.

English Sentences: And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death:
Wolaitta Sentences: Eesawa laittai oitamaa gidiyo wode, Hiitiyaa Bi7eera na7iyo Yooditonne Hiitiyaa Eloona na7iyo Baasemaato machchiis.

English Sentences: Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Yisaaqanne Ribiqo azzanissiiddi de7idosona.

English Sentences: And make me savoury meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi cimin, a aifee xeelaa ixxido wode, ba bairatiya na7aa Eesawa xeesidi a, "Ta na7au" yaagiis. Yaagin i, "Yee" giidi koyiis.

English Sentences: And Rebekah heard when Isaac spake to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koyin i, "Be7a, ha77i taani ceeggaas; taani haiqqana gallassaa erikke.

English Sentences: And Rebekah spake unto Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak unto Esau thy brother, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaniyo gishshau, ha77i ne shankkatiyo wonddafiyaanne zubbiyaa ekkada, bazzo ba; baada do7aa taayyo shankkatada, asho ekkada ya.

English Sentences: Bring me venison, and make me savoury meat, that I may eat, and bless thee before the LORD before my death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mal77o qumaa, taani dosiyoogaa kattada aatta; hegeenne taani haiqqanaappe kase nena anjjanaassa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ribiqa Yisaaqi ba na7aa Eesawayyo yootiyo wode siyausu. Eesawi do7aa shankkatidi ehaanau bazzo biidoogaappe guyyiyan,

English Sentences: Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savoury meat for thy father, such as he loveth:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ribiqa ba na7aa Yaaqooba, "Ne aawai ne ishaa Eesawa,

English Sentences: And thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may bless thee before his death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Do7aa shankkata ehaada, taayyo mal77o qumaa taani maanau katta; hegeenne taani haiqqanaappe kasetada, GODAA sinttan nena anjjanaassa yaagishin taani siyaas.

English Sentences: And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ha77i taani nena azaziyoobaa loittada siya.

English Sentences: My father peradventure will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wudiyaa garssi baada, naa77u anqqara deeshsha marata tau ekkada ya; ehin taani ne aawaayyo mal77o qumaa i dosiyoogaadan kattana.

English Sentences: And his mother said unto him, Upon me be thy curse, my son: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aawai miidi haiqqennan kasetidi nena anjjana mala, assi aattaasa" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savoury meat, such as his father loved.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yaaqoobi ba aayyiyo Ribiqo, "Ta ishaa Eesawa bollan ikisee de7ees; shin ta bollai liiqo.

English Sentences: And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which were with her in the house, and put them upon Jacob her younger son:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta aawai tana oiqqi be7ikko shin? Taani a cimmiyoobaa ayyo milatikko, taani anjjuwaa gishshaa qanggettaa ta bolli ehaanaakkonne" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And she put the skins of the kids of the goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin a aayyiyaa a, "Ta na7au, he qanggettai tana gakko. Taani neeyyo yootiyoogaa ootta; baada deeshsha marata tau ekkada ya" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And she gave the savoury meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biidi ehiidi ba aayeeyyo immiis; immin a aayyiyaa mal77o qumaa a aawai dosiyoogaadan kattaasu.

English Sentences: And he came unto his father, and said, My father: and he said, Here am I; who art thou, my son?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Ribiqa son ba matan de7iya ba baira na7aa Eesawa maayuwaa lo77uwaa ehaada, ba kaalo na7aa Yaaqooba maizzaasu.

English Sentences: And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau thy first born; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi he deeshshatu calaa a kushiyaanne a liiqo qooriyaa maizzaasu.

English Sentences: And Isaac said unto his son, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the LORD thy God brought it to me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maizzada ba kattido mal77o qumaanne oittaa ba na7aa Yaaqooba kushiyan wottaasu.

English Sentences: And Isaac said unto Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son Esau or not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin i ba aawaakko biidi gelidi, "Ta aawau" yaagiis. Yaagin i, "Yee! Ta na7au, neeni oonee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yaaqoobi ba aawaa, "Taani ne baira na7aa Eesawa; neeni tana azazidoogaadan taani oottaas; suura; suura uttada, taani shankkaappe ehiidobaa ma; yaatada tana anjja" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau's hands: so he blessed him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yisaaqi ba na7aa, "Ta na7au, waata eesuwan demmadii?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin i, "GODAI ne Xoossai tana maaddiina" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I am.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi Yaaqooba, "Ta na7au, neeni tumu ta na7aa Eesawakkonne taani oiqqa be7anau ane taakko shiiqa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine, and he drank.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi ba aawaa Yisaaqakko shiiqin oiqqi be7idi, "Ha qaalai Yaaqooba qaalaa; shin kushee Eesawa kushiyaa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And his father Isaac said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
Wolaitta Sentences: A kushee a ishaa Eesawa kushiyaadan ikisiyaara de7iyo gishshau, eribeenna; i erennan a anjjiis.

English Sentences: And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD hath blessed:
Wolaitta Sentences: A, "Tumu neeni ta na7aa Eesawee?" yaagidi oichchiis. Yaagin i, "Ee, tanattennee" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Therefore God give thee of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i, "Ta na7au, taani neeni shankkatidobaa maanau haa aatta; maada taani nena anjjana" yaagiis. Yaaqoobi aattin, i miis; qassi i ayyo woine eessaa ehin uyiis.

English Sentences: Let people serve thee, and nations bow down to thee: be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother's sons bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan a aawaa Yisaaqi, "Ta na7au, haaya; shiiqada tana yera" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi shiiqidi a yeriis; Yisaaqi a maayuwaa singgi siyiiddi, hagaadan yaagidi anjjiis; "Ta na7aa peenoi GODAI anjjido goshshaadan sawees.

English Sentences: And he also had made savoury meat, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that thy soul may bless me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai saluwaa akkaanne sa7aa shicaa, kattaanne ooratta woine eessaa koridi neeyyo immo.

English Sentences: And Isaac his father said unto him, Who art thou? And he said, I am thy son, thy firstborn Esau.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawotettati neeyyo haarettona; asati neeyyo gulbbatona. Neeni ne ishanttuyyo goda gida; ne aayee zareti neeyyo gulbbatona. Nena qanggiyaagee qanggettidaagaa gido; nena anjjiyaagee anjjettidaagaa gido" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi Yaaqooba anjji wurssidoogaappe guyyiyan, Yaaqoobi ba aawaa Yisaaqa sinttappe kiyaanne Eesawi shankkaappe puttu giis.

English Sentences: And when Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ikka qassi mal77o qumaa kattidi, ba aawaayyo aattiis. Aattidi a, "Ta aawau, suura; suura uttada, taani shankkatidobaappe ma; yaatada tana anjja" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin a aawaa Yisaaqi a, "Neeni oonee?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin i, "Taani ne na7aa, ne baira na7aa Eesawa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi dagammidi kokkoriiddi; "Yaatin do7aa shankkatidoogaa ekkidi taayyo aattidaagee oonee? Taani ha77i neeni yaana sinttan maada, a anjjaichchaas; tumukka i anjjettidaagaa gidana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Isaac answered and said unto Esau, Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained him: and what shall I do now unto thee, my son?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eesawi ba aawaa qaalaa siyido wode, ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, daro yibbaata yeehuwaa yeekkiiddi ba aawaa, "Tana anjja; ta aawau, tanakka anjja!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Esau said unto his father, Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father. And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i, "Ne ishai yiidi cimmidi, ne anjjuwaa ekkirggiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eesawi, "A eridi Yaaqooba sunttida; i tana cimmishin, hagee naa77antto; i ta bairatettaa ekkiis; qassi ha77i ta anjjuwaa ekkiis" yaagiis. Qassi i, "Neeni taayyo anjjuwaappe aibanne ashshabeikkii?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin Yisaaqi Eesawa, "Taani a neeyyo goda oottaas; a ishantta ubbaakka a ashkkarata oottaas; qassi taani kattaaninne ooratta woine eessan a minttaas. Yaatin, ta na7au, neeyyo taani ai oottoo?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eesawi ba aawaa, "Ta aawau, neeyyo issi anjjo xalaalai de7ii? Ta aawau, tanakka qassi anjja" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, Eesawi ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And these words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah: and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: A aawaa Yisaaqi zaaridi, "Ne de7iyoosai ha sa7aa duretettaappe haakkana; saluwaa akkaikka neeyyo wodhdhenna;

English Sentences: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;
Wolaitta Sentences: neeni ne bisuwan aqana; neeni ne ishaayyo haarettana. SHin neeni aara eqettiyo wode, a qambbaraa ne morggiyaappe olana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And tarry with him a few days, until thy brother's fury turn away;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqooba a aawai anjjido gishshau, Eesawi ba uluwan a morkkiis; i ba wozanan, "Ta aawai haiqqana matiis; taani ayyo kayyotta simmada, ta ishaa Yaaqooba worana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Until thy brother's anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should I be deprived also of you both in one day?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Ribiqa ha ba baira na7aa Eesawa qaalaa siyido gishshau, ba kaalo na7aa Yaaqooba xeesissa ehaada hagaadan yaagaasu; "Ne ishai Eesawi nena woridi haluwaa kessanau halchchees.

English Sentences: And Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth: if Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these which are of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hayyanaa ta na7au, taani neeyyo odiyoogaa ootta. Dendda! Denddada Kaaraanen de7iya ta ishaa Laabaanakko baqata!

English Sentences: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatada ne ishaa hanqqoi dochchana gakkanaassi, amarida wodiyaa aara de7ashsha.

English Sentences: Arise, go to Padanaram, to the house of Bethuel thy mother's father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother's brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne ishai neeyyo hanqqettiyoogaa aggiyo wodenne, neeni a bolli oottidobaa i baliyo wode, taani kiittada nena yaappe ehiissana. Taani issi gallassi intte naa77aappe mela kiyana koyikke" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Ribiqa Yisaaqa, "Eesawi ekkido Hiitetu macca naatu gaasuwan taani ta de7uwaa shenetaas; qassi Yaaqoobikka hageetu mala Hiitetu macca naatuppe machcho ekkikko, taani simmi haiqqanau koyais" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Yisaaqi Yaaqooba xeesidi hagaadan anjjiisinne azaziis; "Kanaane biittaa macca naatuppe neeyyo machcho ekkoppa.

English Sentences: And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padanaram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dendda! Denddada ne aayee aawaa Baatu7eelakko, Masphphexoomiyaa biitti ba; baada yaappe ne aayee ishaa Laabaana macca naatuppe issinno neeyyo machcho ekka.

English Sentences: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai nena anjjo; i nena yeletisso; neeni issi dere asa keena gakkanaassi nena corisso.

English Sentences: And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padanaram;
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ha77i betetettan uttido ha biittaa nebaa oottana mala neeyyoonne ne zerettaayyo Xoossai Abrahaama anjjuwaa immo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagidi Yisaaqi Yaaqooba yeddiis; yeddin Yaaqoobi Masphphexoomiyaa biitti Laabaanakko biis. Laabaani Yaaqoobanne Eesawa yeliya aayee Ribiqi ishaanne Sooriyaa Baatu7eela na7aa.

English Sentences: Then went Esau unto Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham's son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yisaaqi Yaaqooba anjjidoogaa, yaappe machcho ekkanau Masphphexoomiyaa biitti a yeddidoogaa, qassi i Yaaqooba anjjido wode, "Kanaane maccaasa ekkoppa" yaagidi azazidoogaanne,

English Sentences: And Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi ba aawaayyoonne ba aayeeyyoo azazettidi, Masphphexoomiyaa biitti biidoogaa Eesawi eriis.

English Sentences: And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eesawi hegan Kanaane biittaa maccaasi ba aawaa Yisaaqa ai keenaa iitiyaakko akeekiis.

English Sentences: And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Eesawi Abrahaama na7aa Isimaa7eelakko biidi, a na7iyo Maahilaato ba keettaayetu bolli gujjidi ekkiis. A Nabaayoota michchiyo.

English Sentences: And, behold, the LORD stood above it, and said, I am the LORD God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi Berssaabehappe Kaaraane baanau denddiis.

English Sentences: And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
Wolaitta Sentences: I issi sohuwaa gakkishin awai wullin, yan qammaa aqiis. He sohuwan de7iya shuchchatuppe issuwaa ekkidi, ba huuphiyan borkkotidi he sohuwan xiskkiis.

English Sentences: And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.
Wolaitta Sentences: I aimo aimottiis; he aimuwan gayye issoi biittan eqqin, ayyo xeerai saluwaa gakkiyoogan, Xoossaa kiitanchchati gi77ishiininne wodhdhishin be7iis;

English Sentences: And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.
Wolaitta Sentences: gayyiyaassi bolla xeeran GODAI eqqidi a, "Taani GODAA, ne aawaa Abrahaama Xoossaa, Yisaaqa Xoossaa. Ha neeni zin77ido biittaa neeyyoonne ne zerettaayyo immana;

English Sentences: And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne zerettai sa7aa shafiyaadan darana; neeni arggoora, arshshoora, huuphessaaranne tohossaara de7iya sohota gakkanau aakkana; sa7aa bollan de7iya asai ubbai ne baggaaranne ne zerettaa baggaara anjjettana.

English Sentences: And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani nenaara de7ais; neeni biyoosa ubban taani nena naagana; qassi taani nena ha biitti guyye zaarada ehaana; taani neeyyo oottana giidoogaa oottana gakkanaassi nena yeggikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he called the name of that place Bethel: but the name of that city was called Luz at the first.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi xiskkuwaappe beegottido wode, "GODAI tuma ha sohuwan de7ees; taani erabeikkeppe attin" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,
Wolaitta Sentences: I yayyidi, "Ha sohoi aiba yashshii! Ha sohoi Xoossaa keettappe attin, ainne harasaa gidenna; hagee saluwaa pengge" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So that I come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the LORD be my God:
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi maallado guuran Yaaqoobi denddidi, ba borkkotido shuchchaa ekkidi, tuussadan essidi, Xoossaayyo dummayanau a bolli zaitiyaa tigiis.

English Sentences: And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God's house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi he sohuwaa Beeteele giidi xeesiis. SHin he katamai hegaappe kase Looza geetettees.

English Sentences: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi hagaadan yaagidi shiiqettiis;

English Sentences: And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great stone was upon the well's mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta aawaa soo taani saro simmana mala Xoossai tanaara gidikko, taani biyo ha buussan tana naagikkonne tau miyo qumanne maayiyo maayo immikko, GODAI ta Xoossaa gidana;

English Sentences: And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well's mouth in his place.
Wolaitta Sentences: taani tuussadan essido ha shuchchai Xoossaa keetta gidana. Neeni tau immiyoobaa ubbaappe tammaappe issuwaa taani neeyyo immana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they said, Of Haran are we.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yaaqoobi denddidi biidi, arshsho bagga asatu biitti gakkiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gakkidi issi haattaa ollai dembban de7iyaagaa be7iis; heezzu dorssaa wudeti qassi he ollaa matan zin77idosona. Aissi giikko, wude ubbai haattaa uyiyoi he ollaappe. He haattaa ollaa doonan de7iya shuchchai gita.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Is he well? And they said, He is well: and, behold, Rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dorssaa wude ubbai hegan dagattido wode, he wudiyaa heemmiyaageeti haattaa ollaa doonaappe he shuchchaa gonddorssidi dorssaa ushshoosona. Ushshidi he shuchchaa ollaa doonan zaaridi wottoosona.

English Sentences: And he said, Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together: water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi eta, "Ta ishatoo, intte auppe yiidetii?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin, "Nuuni Kaaraaneppe yiida" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And they said, We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and till they roll the stone from the well's mouth; then we water the sheep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i, "Naakoora na7aa na7aa Laabaana intte ereetiiyye?" yaagiis. Yaagin, "Ee, a eroos" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And while he yet spake with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep: for she kept them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi eta, "I lo77o de7ii?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin, "Ee, lo77o; a na7iyo Raaheelo dorssaa ekkada yiyaaro hanno be7a" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother's brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother's brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yaaqoobi eta, "Be7ite; awai ha77i xoqqan de7ees; wudiyaa mehee soo shiiqiyo wodee biron gakkiichchibeenna; dorssaa ha77i ushshi efiidi, heemmite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti, "Wude ubbai shiiqana gakkanaassinne, shuchchaa haatta ollaa doonaappe gonddorssana gakkanaassi, nuuni ushshanau danddayokko. Hegaappe guyyiyan, nuuni dorssaa ushshana" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father's brother, and that he was Rebekah's son: and she ran and told her father.
Wolaitta Sentences: I biron haasayishin, Laabaana na7iyaa Raaheela ba aawaa dorssata laagga ekkada gakkaasu; aissi giikko, a dorssa henttanchchiyo.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister's son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi ba aayee ishaa Laabaana na7iyo Raaheelo be7ido wodenne, ba aayee ishaa Laabaana dorssaa be7ido wode, biidi ollaa doonaappe shuchchaa gonddorssiis; gonddorssidi ba aayee ishaa dorssata haattaa ushshiis.

English Sentences: And Laban said to him, Surely thou art my bone and my flesh. And he abode with him the space of a month.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi Raaheelo yeridi, ufaissau ba qaalaa xoqqissidi yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nought? tell me, what shall thy wages be?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi iyyo aawaa dabbonne Ribiqee na7aa gidiyoogaa Raaheeliyyo yootiis. Hegaa gishshau a woxxa baada ba aawaayyo yootaasu.

English Sentences: And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laabaani ba michchee na7aa Yaaqooba woriyaa siyidosaarakka, aara gaittanau woxxiis. A idimmi yeridi, ba soo efiis. Yan Yaaqoobi hanidabaa ubbaa Laabaanayyo yootiis.

English Sentences: Leah was tender eyed; but Rachel was beautiful and well favoured.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yootin Laabaani a, "Neeni tumu ta ashonne ta suutta" yaagiis. Yaaqoobi aara issi agina kumettaa uttiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob loved Rachel; and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Laabaani a, "Neeni taayyo dabbo gidido gishshau, tau coo mela oottuuteeyye? Ane neeyyo ai qanxxanau bessiyaakko taayyo yoota" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Laban said, It is better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another man: abide with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laabaanayyo naa77u macca naati de7oosona; bairee sunttai Liyo, kaaleegee Raaheelo.

English Sentences: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few days, for the love he had to her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Liya aifiyaara cuca; shin Raaheela yallisanne puulanchcha.

English Sentences: And Jacob said unto Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in unto her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi Raaheelo siiqidi a, "Taani ne kaalo na7ee Raaheeli gishshau neeyyo laappun laittaa oottana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Laabaani, "O hara asau immanaappe neeyyo immiyoogee lo77o; neeni tanaara hagan de7a" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Yaaqoobi Raaheelo ekkanau laappun laittaa oottiis; shin i o siiqiyo gishshau, ayyo amarida gallassa milatiis.

English Sentences: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid for an handmaid.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Yaaqoobi Laabaana, "Ta machchiyo tau imma; ta wodeenne polettiis; taani o ekkanau koyais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was Leah: and he said to Laban, What is this thou hast done unto me? did not I serve with thee for Rachel? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Laabaani hegan de7iya asaa ubbaa xeesidi, bullachchaa kessiis.

English Sentences: And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin sa7ai qammin, i ba na7iyo Liyo efiidi Yaaqoobau immiis. Immin Yaaqoobi o ekkiis.

English Sentences: Fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Laabaani ba ashkkariyo Zilppo ba na7ee Liyissi danggiriixe gidanaadan immiis.
