Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassi a ishantti Sekeema matan bantta aawaa dorssaa heemmanau biidosona;

English Sentences: And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.
Wolaitta Sentences: bin Israa7eeli Yooseefa, "Ne ishantti Sekeeman wudiyaa heemmiyoogaa eraasa. Haaya; taani nena etakko kiittana" yaagiis. Yaagin Yooseefi, "Eeno" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the man said, They are departed hence; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i a, "Ba; baada ne ishanttinne wudee saro gidiyoogaa be7a; be7ada etabaa taayyo yootaasa" yaagiis. Yaagidi a Kebroona dilbbaappe kiittiis. Kiitettidi i Sekeema biis.

English Sentences: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yan dembbaa giddon i yaa haa simerettishin, issi asi a demmidi, "Na7au, ai koyai?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer cometh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin i, "Ta ishantta koyais; eti wudiyaa heemmiyoosai awaanakkonne hailaa taayyo odarkkii!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him: and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin bitanee, "Hagaappe denddiichchidosona; eti, Nuuni Dootaana boos giishin siyaas" yaagiis. Hegaa gishshau, Yooseefi ba ishanttu geeduwaa biidi, eta Dootaanan demmiis.

English Sentences: And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, Let us not kill him.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i haahuwan de7ishin, eti a be7idosona; i etakko gakkennan de7ishin, eti a woranau a bolli maqettidosona.

English Sentences: And Reuben said unto them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issoi issuwaa, "Be7ite! Aimuwaawai yees.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stript Joseph out of his coat, his coat of many colours that was on him;
Wolaitta Sentences: Haayite; a woridi, ha ollatuppe issuwaa giddo yeggoos. Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iita do7i a miis yaagana; yaatidi a aimoi ehiyoobaa be7ana" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Roobeeli hegaa siyido wode, eta kushiyaappe a ashshanau koyidi, "A worennan aggoos.

English Sentences: And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of Ishmeelites came from Gilead with their camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suutta gussoppite; a intte bazzuwan de7iya ha ollaa giddo olite; a bolli kushe wottoppite" yaagiis. Roobeeli hagaa a etappe ashshidi guyye a aawaakko yeddanau giis.

English Sentences: And Judah said unto his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba ishanttukko gakkido wode, i maayido alleeqettida maayuwaa appe qaari ekkidosona;

English Sentences: Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmeelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brethren were content.
Wolaitta Sentences: a efiidi haatti bainna mela ollan yeggidosona.

English Sentences: Then there passed by Midianites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmeelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta qumaa maanau uttidaashin, Isimaa7eela asati Gibxxe baanau Gala7aadeppe yiyaageeta xoqqu giidi be7idosona; eti bantta gaameelan sawuwaa, balasaane giyo xaliyaanne karbbiyaa caani wottidosona.

English Sentences: And Reuben returned unto the pit; and, behold, Joseph was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai ba ishantta, "Nuuni nu ishaa woridi a suuttaa qosiyaabaa gidikko nuna ai go77ii?

English Sentences: And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child is not; and I, whither shall I go?
Wolaitta Sentences: Haayite; a Isimaa7eelatuyyo baizzoos; a bolli nu kushiyaa wottokko; aissi giikko, i nu ishaa, nu ashuwaa" yaagiis. Yaagin a ishantti maayidosona.

English Sentences: And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Midiyaama biittaa zal77anchchati hegaara aadhdhishin, a ishantti Yooseefa ollaappe kessidi, Isimaa7eela asatuyyo laatamu xaqara biran baizzidosona. Baizzin eti Yooseefa Gibxxe biittaa efiidosona.

English Sentences: And they sent the coat of many colours, and they brought it to their father; and said, This have we found: know now whether it be thy son's coat or no.
Wolaitta Sentences: Roobeeli ollaakko simmidi, Yooseefi yan bainnaagaa be7ido wode, azzanidi ba maayuwaa pooshshiis.

English Sentences: And he knew it, and said, It is my son's coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
Wolaitta Sentences: I guyye ba ishanttukko biidi, "Na7ai yan baawa; ha77i taani au booshsha!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan eti Yooseefa maayuwaa ekkidi, deeshsha orggiyaa shukkidi, he suuttan naaqqidosona.

English Sentences: And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down into the grave unto my son mourning. Thus his father wept for him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Alleeqettida a maayuwaa bantta aawaakko efiidi a, "Nuuni hagaa demmida; hagee ne na7aa maayuwaakkonne ane xeella" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And the Midianites sold him into Egypt unto Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin maayuwaa i eridi, "Hagee ta na7aa maayuwaa! Iita do7i a mirggiis. Yooseefi tumakka zaazettiichchiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagidi Yaaqoobi azzanidi, ba maayuwaa peeriis; ba xeessan waaruwaa gixxidi, ba na7aayyo daro gallassaa yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.
Wolaitta Sentences: A attuma naatinne macca naati ubbai a minttettanau yiidosona; shin i minnennan ixxiis; ixxidi, "CHii, taani yeekkaidda ta na7aakko baada, duufuwan gelana" yaagidi, a aawai ayyo yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name Er.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Midiyaama biittaa asati Yooseefa Gibxxe kawuwaa oosanchchaa PHoxiifaarayyo Gibxxen baizzidosona; i naagiyaageetu halaqa.

English Sentences: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name Onan.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Yihudai ba ishanttuppe shaahettidi, Adulaama giyo kataman de7iya Hiira giyo bitaniyaara de7anau biis.

English Sentences: And she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yan Yihudai SHuu7a giyo Kanaaniyaa na7eera gaittiis; i o ekkidi machchiis.

English Sentences: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ayyo abbe ixettada attuma na7aa yelaasu; yelada a Eera sunttaasu.

English Sentences: And Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka abbe ixettada attuma na7aa yelaasu; yelada a Oonaana sunttaasu.

English Sentences: And Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto thy brother's wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi gujjadakka attuma na7aa yelaasu; yelada a SHeela sunttaasu. A yelidoi Akiziiba giyo biittaana.

English Sentences: And Onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai ba baira na7aa Eerayyo Ti7imaaro giyo machchiyo immiis.

English Sentences: And the thing which he did displeased the LORD: wherefore he slew him also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudaa baira na7ai, Eeri, GODAA sinttan iita asa gidiyo gishshau, GODAI a woriis.

English Sentences: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law, Remain a widow at thy father's house, till Shelah my son be grown: for he said, Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai Oonaana, "Ne ishaa machcheekko gelada, o aissa; ne ishaayyo na7a yelada a xeesissa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Oonaani yelettiya naati baageeta gidennaagaa eriis; hegaa gishshau ba ishaa machcheera zin77iyo wode audenne, ba ishaayyo na7i yelettenna mala, ba zerettaa biittan gussees.

English Sentences: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold thy father in law goeth up to Timnath to shear his sheep.
Wolaitta Sentences: I oottidobai GODAA sinttan iitabaa gidido gishshau, GODAI akka woriis.

English Sentences: And she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath; for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yihudai ba na7aa machchiyo Ti7imaaro, "Ta na7ai SHeeli diccana gakkanaassi ne aawaa soo baada, am77etettan de7ashsha" yaagiis. Hegaa i aibissi giidee giikko, ikka ba ishanttudan haiqqanaakkonne giidi hirggido gishshaassa. Hegaa gishshau Ti7imaara baada ba aawaa son de7aasu.

English Sentences: When Judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro wodiyaappe guyyiyan Yihudaa keettaayyiyaa, SHuu7a na7iyaa haiqqaasu. Yihudai ba kayyuwaappe minettido wode, ba dorssaa ikisiyaa meediya asatukko Timina kiyiis; qassi a laggee, Adulaamiyaa Hiiri aara biis.

English Sentences: And he turned unto her by the way, and said, Go to, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she was his daughter in law.) And she said, What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai Ti7imaaro, "Be7a; ne bolloi Yihudai, ba dorssatu ikisiyaa meedanau Timina kiyees" yaagidi yootiis.

English Sentences: And he said, I will send thee a kid from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba am77etettaa maayuwaa qaaraasu; bana balettanau shaashiyaa ekkada gullettaasu. Gullettada Timina efiya ogiyaa doonan de7iya Enaima katamaa penggen uttaasu. Hegaa a oottidoogee, SHeeli dicci gakkinkka a ayyo machcho gidanau imettabeennaagaa erido gishshaassa.

English Sentences: And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. And he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai o be7ido wode, shaaramuxa giidi qoppiis; aissi giikko, a ba som77uwaa gulletta uttaasu.

English Sentences: And she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba na7aa machchiyo gidiyoogaa erennan de7iiddi, ogiyaa gaxaa ikko shiiqidi o, "Tanaara zin77arkki!" yaagiis. Yaagin a, "Taani nenaara zin77ikko, neeni taayyo ai immuutee?" yaagada oichchaasu.

English Sentences: And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: but he found her not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin i, "Taani ta wudiyaappe issi deeshsha maraa neeyyo yeddana" yaagiis. Yaagin a, "Neeni hegaa taayyo yeddana gakkanaassi ai oittuutee?" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, Where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? And they said, There was no harlot in this place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i, "Ai oittoo?" yaagiis. Yaagin a, "Ne maatafa wottiyo migiduwaa, a aattiyo baqettaanne ne kushiyan de7iya gatimaa oitta" yaagaasu. Yaagin i hegeeta immidi, iira zin77in, a ayyo shahaaraasu.

English Sentences: And he returned to Judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.
Wolaitta Sentences: A hegaappe denddada biidoogaappe guyyiyan, ba gullettaa shaashiyaa qaarada, ba am77etettaa maayuwaa maayaasu.

English Sentences: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai ba oittidobaa he mishireeppe zaari ekkanau deeshsha maraa ba laggiyaa Adulaama bolli iyyo kiittiis; shin i o demmibeenna.

English Sentences: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
Wolaitta Sentences: I he biittaa asaa, "Enaima kataman, ogiyaa doonan uttida shaaramuxa maccaasiyaa awaanee?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin asai, "SHaaramuxa maccaasi hagan mulekka baawa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i Yihudaakko simmidi a, "Taani o demmabeikke; hegaa bollikka he biittaa asai, SHaaramuxa maccaasi hagan mulekka baawa yaagiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Judah acknowledged them, and said, She hath been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yihudai, "Ba oiqqidoogaa bau ekku; hegee xayikko, asi nuna miiccana. Simmi taani iyyo deeshsha maraa yeddaas; shin neeni o demmabaakka" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzu agina keenaappe guyyiyan asai, "Ne na7aa maccaasiyaa Ti7imaara shaaramuxada shahaaraasu" yaagidi Yihudaayyo yootiis. Yootin Yihudai, "O kare kessidi taman xuuggite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
Wolaitta Sentences: O kare kessiyo wode, "Taani shahaaridoogee ha miishshatu godaassa; be7a; ha maatafa wottiyo migidoi, a aattiyo baqettainne gatimai obaakko erana danddayikko era" yaagada ba bolluwaassi kiitaa kiittaasu.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, How hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called Pharez.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai he miishshata eridi, "Taappe a xillo; aissi giikko, taani o ta na7aa SHeelayyo immabeikke" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, i iira haranttuwaa zin77ibeenna.

English Sentences: And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zarah.
Wolaitta Sentences: A yelana haniyo wode, i uluwan mentte attuma naati de7oosona.

English Sentences: And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.
Wolaitta Sentences: A maarettishin, etappe issoi ba kushiyaa kessiis; kessin maaretissiyaara, "Be7ite; hagee koiro kiyees" gaanau zo7o qunccuutiyaa ekkada a kushiyan qachchaasu.

English Sentences: And the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ba kushiyaa guyye ekkido wode, a ishai kiyiis; kiyin a, "Neeni waana porxxu gaada kiyadii!" yaagaasu. Hegaa gishshau, Paareesa gaada a sunttaasu.

English Sentences: And his master saw that the LORD was with him, and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, a kushiyan zo7o qunccuutee de7iyo a ishai kiyiis; a sunttai Zaraaha geetettiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isimaa7eela asati Yooseefa Gibxxe efi wottidosona. Efin Gibxxiyaa PHoxiifaari, kawuwaa oosanchchatuppe issoi, naagiyaageetu halaqai Yooseefa Isimaa7eelatuppe shammiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of the LORD was upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Yooseefaara de7ees; hegaa gishshau, i oottiyoobaa ubbaa ayyo injjeyiis; yaatin ba godaa, Gibxxiyaa son de7iis.

English Sentences: And he left all that he had in Joseph's hand; and he knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. And Joseph was a goodly person, and well favoured.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI aara de7iyoogaanne GODAI i oottidobaa ubbaa ayyo injjeyiyoogaa PHoxiifaari be7ido wode,

English Sentences: And it came to pass after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes upon Joseph; and she said, Lie with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi a sinttan nashettiis; i ayyo kiitettiis. PHoxiifaari a ba keettaa asaa bolli sunttiis; bau de7iyaabaa ubbaa a kushiyan wottiis.

English Sentences: But he refused, and said unto his master's wife, Behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand;
Wolaitta Sentences: PHoxiifaari ba keettan de7iyaabaa ubbaa bollinne ba aquwaa ubbaa bolli sunttido wodiyaappe doommidi, GODAI Gibxxe bitaniyaa keettaa Yooseefa gishshau anjjiis. GODAA anjjoi PHoxiifaarayyo sooninne gaden de7ida ubbabaa bolli wodhdhiis.

English Sentences: There is none greater in this house than I; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau baayyo de7iya ubbabaa Yooseefau sheedhdhiis; i ba miyo qumaappe attin, ainne qoppenna. Yooseefi yallisanne puulanchcha asa.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as she spake to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amarida wodiyaappe guyyiyan, a godaa keettaayyiyaa Yooseefa xeella be7ada, "Haaya; tanaara zin77a" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And it came to pass about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ixxiis. Ba godaa keettaayyiyo, "Be7a; ta godai tau sheedhdhidi ba son de7iyaabau aibaunne hirggenna; baayyo de7iyaabaa ubbaa ta kushiyan wottiis.

English Sentences: And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha son taappe gitatiyai ooninne baawa. Neeni a keettaayyiyo gidiyo gishshau ne xalaalappe attin, ta godai taayyo immibeennabi baawa. Yaatin taani waatada hagaa mala daro iitabaa hanada Xoossaa bolli nagaraa oottoo?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth,
Wolaitta Sentences: A ha yohuwaa hachchi hachchi Yooseefau yootikkonne, i iira zin77ennan woikko i matan uttennan ixxiis.

English Sentences: That she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, See, he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassi i ba oosuwaa oottanau soo geliis; geliyo wode, so ashkkaratuppe ooninne son baawa.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out.
Wolaitta Sentences: A Yooseefa afalaa oiqqada, "Tanaara zin77a" yaagaasu. SHin i ba afalaa i kushiyan yeggidi, sooppe kare woxxidi kiyiis.

English Sentences: And she laid up his garment by her, until his lord came home.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba afalaa i kushiyan yeggidi, sooppe kare woxxiichchidoogaa a be7ido wode,

English Sentences: And she spake unto him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me:
Wolaitta Sentences: ba so ashkkarata xeesada eta, "Be7ite; ta keettaawai ehiido ha Ibraawe bitanee tana kaushshirggidi ashshiis; i tanaara zin77anau hagaa geliis; shin taani ta qaalaa xoqqissada waassaas.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani waassin siyido wode, i ba afalaa ta matan yeggidi, sooppe kare woxxidi kiyiis" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spake unto him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
Wolaitta Sentences: A godai soo yaana gakkanaassi a Yooseefa afalaa ba matan wottaasu.

English Sentences: And Joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, a ayyo hagaadan yaagada odaasu; "Hegee neeni nuuyyo ehiido Ibraawe aillee tanaara zin77anau taakko geliis;

English Sentences: But the LORD was with Joseph, and shewed him mercy, and gave him favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin taani ta qaalaa xoqqissada waassidoogee, ba afalaa ta matan yeggidi, sooppe kare woxxiis" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: A godai ba keettaayyiyaa, "Ne aillee tana hagaadan oottiis" yaagada yootido qaalaa siyidi, hanqquwaa suulliis.

English Sentences: The keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because the LORD was with him, and that which he did, the LORD made it to prosper.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefa godai a efiidi, kawuwaa qashuwaasai de7iyo qasho keettan yeggiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker had offended their lord the king of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yooseefi yan qasho keettan de7iyo wode, GODAI aara de7ees. I ayyo qarettiis; qasho keettaa halaqaa sinttan ayyo nashuwaa immiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh was wroth against two of his officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanin qasho keettaa halaqai qashuwaasaa ubbaa Yooseefa kushiyan wottiis; hegan oosettiyaabaa ubbaa oottiyaagee a.

English Sentences: And he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qasho keettaa halaqai Yooseefa kushiyan de7iyaabau aibaunne hirggenna; aissi giikko, GODAI aara de7ees; i oottiyoobaakka ubbaa ayyo injjeyiis.

English Sentences: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amarida wodiyaappe guyyiyan, Gibxxe kawuwaa eessaa tigiyaageenne oittaa uukkiyaagee bantta godaa Gibxxe kawuwaa naaqqidosona.

English Sentences: And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, which were bound in the prison.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi eessaa tigiyaageetu halaqaayyoonne oittaa uukkiyaageetu halaqaayyo naa77aayyookka keehi hanqqettiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqqettidi Yooseefi qashettido qasho keettan, naagiyaageetu halaqaa son eta wottiis.

English Sentences: And he asked Pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord's house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly to day?
Wolaitta Sentences: Naagiyaageetu halaqai eta Yooseefau sheedhdhiis; i etau oottees. Eti qasho keettan amarida wodiyaa uttidosona.

English Sentences: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe kawuwaayyo eessaa tigiyaageenne oittaa uukkiyaagee, qasho keettan de7iya naa77aikka, issi qammi dumma dumma aimuwaa aimottidosona. Qassi aimotuyyo huuphiyan huuphiyan eta birshshettai de7ees.

English Sentences: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi maallado etakko gelido wode, azzani uttidaageeta be7iis.

English Sentences: And in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau ba godaa son banaara qasho keettan de7iya kawuwaa oosanchchata, "Hachchi intte som77oi aibissi xumidee?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh's cup was in my hand: and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oichchin eti a, "Nuuni naa77ai aimo aimottida; shin nuuyyo birshshiyaabi xayiis" yaagidosona. Yaagin Yooseefi eta, "Aimo birshshettai Xoossaabaa gidenneeyye? Intte aimuwaa taayyo yootite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin eessaa tigiyaageetu halaqai ba aimuwaa Yooseefayyo hagaadan yaagidi yootiis; "Taani ta aimuwan issi woiniyaa turaa ta sinttan be7aas.

English Sentences: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi he woiniyaa turaayyo heezzu tashee de7ees. I maraa yelidi, ciishshaa ciyyidi, wurccuwaa wurcciis; wurccoinne teeriis.

English Sentences: But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa wanccai ta kushiyan de7ees; taani woiniyaa teeraa ekkada, kawuwaa wanccan gum77ada, he wanccaa a kushiyan wottaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: For indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yooseefi, "Hegaa birshshettai hagaa; heezzu tasheti heezzu gallassata.

English Sentences: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, I had three white baskets on my head:
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzu gallassatu giddon kawoi nena denttana; denttidi i nena kase ne sunttatettau zaarana; kase neeni eessaa tigiyo wode oottidoogaadan, neeni kawuwaa wanccaa a kushiyan wottana.

English Sentences: And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for Pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeyyo sa7ai kehido wode tana dogoppa; taayyo keha; tabaa kawuwaayyo yootada, ha qasho keettaappe tana kesissa;

English Sentences: And Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days:
Wolaitta Sentences: aissi giikko, tana Ibraawetu biittaappe gubaayidi ehiidosona; harai atto hagankka tana qashissiyaabaa ainne oottabeikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oittaa uukkiyaageetu halaqai Yooseefi aimuwaa loitti birshshidoogaa be7ido wode Yooseefa, "Taanikka aimo aimottaas; ta huuphiyan heezzu samppa oittai de7ees;

English Sentences: And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
Wolaitta Sentences: bolla bagga samppan Gibxxe kawuwaayyo uukettida ubba qommo oittai de7ees. SHin kafoi hegaa ta huuphiyan de7iya samppaappe mees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yooseefi, "Hegaa birshshettai hagaa; heezzu samppati heezzu gallassata.

English Sentences: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzu gallassatu giddon kawoi nena denttana; denttidi ne qooriyaa muucissidi mittan kaqissana; ne ashuwaanne kafoi maana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzantta gallassan Gibxxe kawoi ba yelettido gallassi ba oosanchchatu ubbaayyo gibiraa giigissiis. Eessaa tigiyaageetu halaqaanne oittaa uukkiyaageetu halaqaa denttidi, ba oosanchchatu gidduwan essiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eessaa tigiyaageetu halaqaa a sunttatettau zaarin, i kawuwaa kushiyan wanccaa wottiis.

English Sentences: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin kawoi oittaa uukkiyaageetu halaqaa eta aimuwaa birshshettaa Yooseefi yootidoogaadankka kaqissiis.

English Sentences: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eessaa tigiyaageetu halaqai Yooseefa hassayibeenna; dogi aggiis.

English Sentences: And the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u laitta kumettai aadhdhido wode, Gibxxe kawoi aimo aimottiis; aimuwan i Naile SHaafaa doonan eqqiis;

English Sentences: And he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
Wolaitta Sentences: eqqidaashin laappun orddenne modhdho miizzati Naile SHaafaappe kiyi wodhdhidi, shombboquwaa giddon miishin be7iis.

English Sentences: And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe simmin, hara laappun meraa iitanne gilqqa miizzati Naile SHaafaappe kiyidosona; kiyidi shaafaa doonan de7iya hara miizzatu matan eqqidosona.

English Sentences: And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
Wolaitta Sentences: He meraa iitanne gilqqa miizzati laappun orddenne modhdho miizzata miidosona. Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi beegottiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
Wolaitta Sentences: I zaaretti xiskkidi, naa77antto aimuwaakka aimottiis; laappun lo77onne muruta tiyati issi anuwan diccidosona.

English Sentences: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe simmin, shoggettidanne arshsho bagga carkkuwan shullida hara laappun tiyati kiyidosona.

English Sentences: Pharaoh was wroth with his servants, and put me in ward in the captain of the guard's house, both me and the chief baker:
Wolaitta Sentences: He shoggettida tiyati lo77onne muruta tiyata mittidosona. Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi beegottidi, aimo gidiyoogaa eriis.

English Sentences: And we dreamed a dream in one night, I and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7ai wonttin, a wozanai shabbirettiis; hegaa gishshau Gibxxen de7iya bitanchchatu ubbaunne aadhdhida eranchchatu ubbau kiittidi xeesissiis; kawoi etayyo ba aimuwaa yootiis; shin ayyo he aimuwaa birshshiyaabi xayiis.

English Sentences: And there was there with us a young man, an Hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eessaa tigiyaageetu halaqai he wode Gibxxe kawuwaa hagaadan yaagiis; "Taani ta mooruwaa hachchi hassayais.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issitoo kawoi ba ashkkaratuyyo hanqqettidi, tananne oittaa uukkiyaageetu halaqaa qasho keettan yeggiis.

English Sentences: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto Pharaoh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yan de7iiddi nuuni huuphiyan huuphiyan aimo aimottida; aimuwaayyo dumma dumma birshshettai de7ees.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode naagiyaageetu halaqaa ashkkarai, Ibraawe wodallai nunaara qasho keettan de7ees. Nuuni nu aimuwaa ayyo yootida; yootin i nuuyyo huuphiyan huuphiyan aimuwaa birshshiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: God shall give Pharaoh an answer of peace.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanin he yohoti i nuuyyo birshshidoogaadankka hanidosona. Hegee aibee giikko, taani ta sunttatettau simmaas; hinkko bitanee kaqettiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon the bank of the river:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Gibxxe kawoi Yooseefayyo kiittidi xeesissiis. Eti a qasho keettaappe eesuwan ehiidosona. I meedettidi ba maayuwaa laammidi, kawuwaakko geliis.

English Sentences: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fatfleshed and well favoured; and they fed in a meadow:
Wolaitta Sentences: Gelin kawoi Yooseefa, "Taani aimo aimottaas; shin a issoinne birshshanau danddayibeenna. SHin taani, Yooseefi aimo siyikko, birshshanau danddayees giyoogaa siyaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill favoured and leanfleshed, such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for badness:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yooseefi, "Taani hegaa danddayikke; shin Xoossai kawuwaayyo likke birshshettaa immana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the lean and the ill favoured kine did eat up the first seven fat kine:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin kawoi, "Taani ta aimuwan Naile SHaafaa doonan eqqidaashin,

English Sentences: And when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ill favoured, as at the beginning. So I awoke.
Wolaitta Sentences: laappun orddenne modhdho miizzati Naile SHaafaappe kiyidi, shombboquwaa giddon moosona.

English Sentences: And I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good:
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe simmin, hara laappun meraa iita, gilqqanne laafa miizzati kiyidosona; taani hegaa mala meraa iita miizza Gibxxe biittan mulekka be7a erikke.

English Sentences: And, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:
Wolaitta Sentences: Meraa iitanne laafa miizzati koiroogeeta, laappun modhdho miizzata miidosona.

English Sentences: And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and I told this unto the magicians; but there was none that could declare it to me.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eta miidoogaappe guyyiyankka, eti miidobaa ooninne eranau danddayibeenna; aissi giikko, eta merai kaseegaadankka iiti uttiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan taani beegottaas.

English Sentences: And Joseph said unto Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one: God hath shewed Pharaoh what he is about to do.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta aimuwan qassi laappun lo77onne muruta tiyata issi anuwan diccidaageeta be7aas.

English Sentences: The seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe simmin, shoggettidanne arshsho bagga carkkuwan shullida hara laappun tiyati kiyidosona.

English Sentences: And the seven thin and ill favoured kine that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind shall be seven years of famine.
Wolaitta Sentences: He shoggettida tiyati laappun lo77o tiyata mittidosona. Taani ha aimuwaa bitanchchatuyyo yootaas; shin taayyo aimuwaa birshshiyaabi beettibeenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: This is the thing which I have spoken unto Pharaoh: What God is about to do he sheweth unto Pharaoh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Yooseefi Gibxxe kawuwaa, "Kawuwaa aimoti issuwaa. Xoossai ba oottana haniyoobaa kawuwaayyo qonccissiis.

English Sentences: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt:
Wolaitta Sentences: He laappun lo77o miizzati laappun laittata; qassi laappun lo77o tiyati laappun laittata; ha aimoi issuwaa.

English Sentences: And there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;
Wolaitta Sentences: He laappun meraa iitanne laafa miizzati laappun laittata; qassi arshsho bagga carkkuwan shullida, pattenna laappun tiyati laappun kosha laittata.

English Sentences: And the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine following; for it shall be very grievous.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani kawuwaayyo yootidoogaadankka, Xoossai ba oottana haniyoobaa kawuwaa bessiis.

English Sentences: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laappun daro kalo laittati Gibxxe biittau ubbau yaana;

English Sentences: Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin laappun kosha laittai hegaa kaallana. He wode Gibxxe kaloi ubbai dogettana; koshai biittaa xiixxana.

English Sentences: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.
Wolaitta Sentences: He biittaa kaloi hassayettennan attana; aissi giikko, hegaa kaallida koshai keehi suullana.

English Sentences: And let them gather all the food of those good years that come, and lay up corn under the hand of Pharaoh, and let them keep food in the cities.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u ogiyan kawuwaayyo he aimoi beettidoi aibissee giikko, ha yohuwaa Xoossai minttidi kuuyido gishshassa; Xoossai hegaa eesuwan oottana.

English Sentences: And that food shall be for store to the land against the seven years of famine, which shall be in the land of Egypt; that the land perish not through the famine.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha77i simmi, kawoi aadhdhida eranne cincca asa koyidi, Gibxxe biittan suntto.

English Sentences: And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi biittan sunttata laappun kalo laittan qoxxiyo kattaappe ichchashu kushiyaappe issuwaa shiishshanau suntto.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh said unto his servants, Can we find such a one as this is, a man in whom the Spirit of God is?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti yiya kalo laittatun kattaa shiishshidi, kawuwaa aawatettan minjjona; he kattaa katamatun naagona.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Forasmuch as God hath shewed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art:
Wolaitta Sentences: Biittai koshan xayenna mala, ha kattai Gibxxe biittan laappun laittan denddana koshaayyo minjjettidi de7o" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin ha yohoi Gibxxe kawuwaayyoonne a oosanchchatuyyo lo77o gididi beettiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, See, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau kawoi eta, "Nuuni Xoossaa Ayyaanaara de7iya hagaa mala hara asa demmaneeyye?" yaagidi oichchiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon Joseph's hand, and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi Yooseefa, "Xoossai hagaa ubbaa nena erissido gishshau, ne mala aadhdhida erinne cincci ooninne baawa.

English Sentences: And he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before him, Bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani nena ta keettan sunttais; ta asai ubbai neeyyo azazettana; taani neeppe aadhdhanai ta kawotaa araataa xalaalaana gidana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau kawoi Yooseefa, "Be7a; taani nena Gibxxe biittaa ubbaa bollan sunttaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphnathpaaneah; and he gave him to wife Asenath the daughter of Potipherah priest of On. And Joseph went out over all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, kawoi ba paramiyo migiduwaa ba biradhdhiyaappe kessidi, Yooseefa biradhdhiyan wottiis. Liinuwaappe dadettida maayuwaa i a maizzidi, a qooriyankka worqqa sanssalataa aattiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi ba naa77antto paraa gaariyaa Yooseefa togissiis; ashkkarati, "Ziggite! Ziggite!" yaagiiddi appe sinttaara hemettidosona. Hagaadan oottidi, kawoi a Gibxxe biittaa ubbaa bollan sunttiis.

English Sentences: And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi Yooseefa, "Taani kawuwaa; shin neeni dentto geennan Gibxxe biitta ubban ooninne kushe woi toho denttenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he gathered up all the food of the seven years, which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every city, laid he up in the same.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi Yooseefa, "Xaafinaati-Pa7inaaha" giidi sunttiis; i ayyo Ooni giyo katamaa qeesiyaa PHoxiifeera na7iyo Asinaato machcho immiis. Yaanin Yooseefi Gibxxe biittaa ubbasaara kanttiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi Gibxxe kawuwaayyo oottanau doommiyo wode, ayyo laittai hasttama. Qassi Yooseefi kawuwaa sinttappe kiyidi, Gibxxe biittaa ubbaa gidduwaa hemettiis.

English Sentences: And unto Joseph were born two sons before the years of famine came, which Asenath the daughter of Potipherah priest of On bare unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: He laappun kalo laittatun biittai daro kattaa mokkiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh: For God, said he, hath made me forget all my toil, and all my father's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi Gibxxe biittan he laappun kalo laitta kattaa ubbaa shiishshidi, katamatun minjjiis. Issi issi katamaa yuushuwan de7iya goshshaa kattaa ubbaa he katamatun minjjiis.

English Sentences: And the name of the second called he Ephraim: For God hath caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi abbaa shafiyaa keena daro kattaa minjjiis; kattai darin, makkanau danddayibeenna gishshau, makki makki qoliyoogaa aggi bayiis.

English Sentences: And the seven years of plenteousness, that was in the land of Egypt, were ended.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kosha laittai yaanaappe kase, Oona katamaa qeesiyaa PHoxiifeera na7ee Asinaatippe Yooseefi naa77u attuma naata yeliis.

English Sentences: And the seven years of dearth began to come, according as Joseph had said: and the dearth was in all lands; but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba baira na7aa Minaasa sunttiis; aissi giikko i, "Xoossai tana ta metuwaa ubbaanne ta aawaa so asaa ubbaa dogissiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread: and Pharaoh said unto all the Egyptians, Go unto Joseph; what he saith to you, do.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77antto na7aa Efireema sunttiis; aissi giikko, i, "Xoossai taayyo ta tuggatido biittan tana aifissiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the famine was over all the face of the earth: And Joseph opened all the storehouses, and sold unto the Egyptians; and the famine waxed sore in the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe biittan de7iya he laappun kalo laittati wuridosona.

English Sentences: And all countries came into Egypt to Joseph for to buy corn; because that the famine was so sore in all lands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Yooseefi yootidoogaadan laappun kosha laittati doommidosona. Hara biittan ubban koshai denddiis; shin Gibxxe biitta ubban kattai de7ees.

English Sentences: Now when Jacob saw that there was corn in Egypt, Jacob said unto his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe biittai ubbai koshatido wode, asai kattau kawuwaayyo waassiis. Waassin kawoi Gibxxe asaa ubbaa, "Yooseefakko biite; biidi i yootiyoobaa oottite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt: get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koshai Gibxxe biittaa ubbaa gakkido wode, Yooseefi kattaa minjjido keettata ubbaa dooyidi, kattaa Gibxxe asau baizziis; aissi giikko, Gibxxen koshai suulliis.

English Sentences: And Joseph's ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7a ubban koshai suullido gishshau, sa7an de7iya asai ubbai kattaa Yooseefappe woommanau Gibxxe yiis.

English Sentences: But Benjamin, Joseph's brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren; for he said, Lest peradventure mischief befall him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaqoobi Gibxxen kattai de7iyoogaa siyido wode, ba attuma naata, "Intte issoi issuwaa aissi xeelleetii?

English Sentences: And the sons of Israel came to buy corn among those that came: for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7ite! Gibxxen kattai de7iyoogaa taani siyaas; yaa duge biidi, nuuni haiqqennan paxa de7ana mala, yaappe amaridabaa nuuyyo woommite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph's brethren came, and bowed down themselves before him with their faces to the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yooseefa ishantti tammati kattaa woommanau duge Gibxxe biidosona.

English Sentences: And Joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them; and he said unto them, Whence come ye? And they said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yaaqoobi Yooseefa ishaa Biniyaama a ishanttuura yeddibeenna; aissi giikko, i qohettanaakkonne giidi qoppiis.

English Sentences: And Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kanaane biittan wolqqaama koshai de7iyo gishshau, kattaa woommanau yiidaageetuura Israa7eela attuma naati Gibxxe gelidosona.

English Sentences: And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, Ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Yooseefi he biittaa aissiyaagaanne biittan de7iya asau ubbau kattaa baizziyaagaa; hegaa gishshau Yooseefa ishantti gakkido wode, bantta som77uwaa sa7aa gattidi ayyo ziggidosona.

English Sentences: And they said unto him, Nay, my lord, but to buy food are thy servants come.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba ishantta be7osaara eri bayiis; shin i eta erennabaadan harshshuushiis; i eta, "Intte awappe yiidetii?" yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin eti, "Katta woommanau, Kanaane biittaappe yiida" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: We are all one man's sons; we are true men, thy servants are no spies.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba ishantta eriis; shin eti a eribookkona.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Nay, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yooseefi etabaa aimottido ba aimuwaa hassayidi eta, "Intte wochchi xeelliya asa; intte nu biittan naagoi leppiyo baggai augaakko be7anau yiideta" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they said, Thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin eti, "CHii, nu godau, nuuni wochchi xeelliya asa gidokko; nuuni ne ashkkarati kattaa woommanau yiida.

English Sentences: And Joseph said unto them, That is it that I spake unto you, saying, Ye are spies:
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni ubbaikka issi aawaa naata. Nuuni ne ashkkarati ammanettiya asa" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Hereby ye shall be proved: By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yooseefi eta, "CHii; intte nu biittan naagoi leppiyo baggai augaakko be7anau yiideta" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye shall be kept in prison, that your words may be proved, whether there be any truth in you: or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye are spies.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti, "Nuuni ne ashkkarati tammanne naa77u ishanttanne Kanaane biittan de7iya issi bitaniyaa naata. Wurssetta kaaloi ha77i nu aawaara de7ees; issoi xayiis" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he put them all together into ward three days.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi eta, "Taani intteyyo yootidoogaadankka intte biittaa wochchiyaageeta.

English Sentences: And Joseph said unto them the third day, This do, and live; for I fear God:
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi intte paacettanaagee hagaana; tumuppe kawoi haiqqo; intte wurssetta kaalo ishai hagaa yaana xayikko, intte ha sohuwaappe beekketa.

English Sentences: If ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison: go ye, carry corn for the famine of your houses:
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte yootiyoogee tuma gidiyoogaa paaccanau, intteppe issuwaa kiittite; i intte ishaa ekkidi yo; attidaageeti qasho keettan qashettishsheeta. Hegaa gidana xayikko, kawoi haiqqo; intte biittaa wochchiyaageeta" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But bring your youngest brother unto me; so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die. And they did so.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagidi eta heezzu gallassau qasho keettan yeggiis.

English Sentences: And they said one to another, We are verily guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his soul, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzantta gallassan Yooseefi eta, "Taani Xoossau yayyiya asa; intte issibaa oottikko, paxa de7ana.

English Sentences: And Reuben answered them, saying, Spake I not unto you, saying, Do not sin against the child; and ye would not hear? therefore, behold, also his blood is required.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte tumukka ammanettiya asa gidikko, intte ishanttuppe issoi hagan qasho keettan de7o; attidaageeti namisettiya intte so asau kattaa ekkidi efiite;

English Sentences: And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin intte qaalaa tumayana malanne intte haiqqenna mala intte intte wurssetta kaalo ishaa taakko ehaana koshshees" yaagiis. Etinne ha yohuwaa maayidosona.

English Sentences: And he turned himself about from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them Simeon, and bound him before their eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti issoi issuwaa, "Tumu nuuni nu ishau oottidobai nuna kaa7ees. I ba shemppuwaayyo haniyoobai ixxin, nuussi watiwatiyo wode, nuuni siyiiddi ixxida; ha waayee nuna gakkidoogee hegaa gishshassa" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn, and to restore every man's money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus did he unto them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Roobeeli, "Taani inttena, Na7aa bolli nagara oottoppite gaada yootabeikkinaa? SHin intte siyennan ixxideta. Simmi ha77i, a suuttai nuna achchees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they laded their asses with the corn, and departed thence.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti giyoobaa Yooseefi eridoogaa eti akeekibookkona; aissi giikko, i etaara wokkaaliyan haasayees.

English Sentences: And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn, he espied his money; for, behold, it was in his sack's mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: I etappe wora simmidi yeekkiis; shin qassi etakko simmidi, etayyo gujjidi haasayiis. I Simoona etappe duutti ashshidi eti be7ishin qachchiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, What is this that God hath done unto us?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba ashkkarata, "Kattaa eta ogoruwaa kunttite; eta biraakka zaaridi, eta ogoruwan ogoruwan wottite; qassi etau ogiyaassi shinqqiyaa immite" yaagidi azaziis.

English Sentences: And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan, and told him all that befell unto them; saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Azazin i giidoogaadan oottidoogaappe guyyiyan, Yooseefa ishantti kattaa bantta haretun caanidi, denddidi biidosona.

English Sentences: The man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti qammaa aqanau simmidosan etappe issoi ba hariyaayyo kattaappe yegganau ba ogoruwaa birshshidi, he ogoruwaayyo doonan de7iya ba biraa be7iis.

English Sentences: And we said unto him, We are true men; we are no spies:
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7idi i ba ishantta, "Ta birai taayyo simmiis; tumu hagaa be7ite! Ta ogoruwan de7ees" yaagiis. Eta wozanai taahin, kokkoriiddi issoi issuwaakko simmidi, "Xoossai nu bolli oottidobi hagee aibee?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: We be twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Kanaane biittan de7iya bantta aawaa Yaaqoobakko yiido wode, banttana gakkidabaa ubbaa ayyo odidosona.

English Sentences: And the man, the lord of the country, said unto us, Hereby shall I know that ye are true men; leave one of your brethren here with me, and take food for the famine of your households, and be gone:
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ayyo, "He biittaayyo goda gidiya bitanee nuna harshshuushiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, i nuna he biittaa wochchiyaabaadan godatiis.

English Sentences: And bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall I know that ye are no spies, but that ye are true men: so will I deliver you your brother, and ye shall traffick in the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin nuuni a, Nuuni ammanettiya asa; biittaa wochchiyaageeta gidokko.

English Sentences: And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every man's bundle of money was in his sack: and when both they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni tammanne naa77u ishantti issi aawaa naata; issoi xayiis; wurssetta kaaloi Kanaane biittan ha77i nu aawaara de7ees yaagida.

English Sentences: And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved of my children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin away: all these things are against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin he biittaayyo goda gidiya bitanee nuna, Intte ammanettiya asa gidiyoogaa taani hagan erana; intte ishanttuppe issuwaa hagan ta matan yeggidi, namisettiya intte so asaayyo kattaa ekkidi biite.

English Sentences: And Reuben spake unto his father, saying, Slay my two sons, if I bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to thee again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte biittaa wochchiyaageeta gidennan, ammanettiya asa gidiyoogaa taani erana mala, intte wurssetta kaalo ishaa taakko ekki yiite. Yaatikko taani han attida intte ishaa intteyyo zaarada immana; inttenne ha biittan zal77eeta giis" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go, then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta ogoruwaappe kattaa qoliiddi, bantta ogoruwan ogoruwan bantta biraa qashuwaara uttidaagaa demmidosona. Etinne eta aawai he qashuwaara de7iya biraa be7idi yayyidosona.

English Sentences: And the famine was sore in the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta aawaa Yaaqoobi eta, "Intte tana ta naatuppe mela kessideta; Yooseefi baawa, Simooni baawa; qassi intte Biniyaama efaana koyeeta. Ubbabai taayyo tiraara sitti giis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy us a little food.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Roobeeli ba aawaa, "Taani Biniyaama neeyyo zaarada ehaana xayikko, ta attuma naata naa77aakka wora; tana ammanettada a ta kushiyan wotta; qassi taani a zaarada ehaana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Judah spake unto him, saying, The man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yaaqoobi eta, "Ta na7ai inttenaara yaa duge beenna; a ishai haiqqiichchin, attidaagee a xalaala; intte efishin, ogiyan iitabi a gakkiyaabaa gidikko, intte ta puuluntta huuphiyaa azzanuwaara duufuwan yeggana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77inne koshai Kanaane biittan wolqqaamiis.

English Sentences: But if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down: for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanin eti Gibxxeppe ehiido kattaa ubbaa mi wurssirggin, eta aawai, "Qassikka guyye biidi nuuyyo amarida katta woommite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Israel said, Wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yihudai a, "He bitanee nuna, Intte ishai inttenaara yaana xayikko, ta som77uwaa zaari be7ekketa yaagidi mintti yootiis.

English Sentences: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni nu ishaa nunaara yeddikko, nuuni duge biidi neeyyo kattaa shammana.

English Sentences: And Judah said unto Israel his father, Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni a yeddennabaa gidikko, nuuni duge bookko; aissi giikko, he bitanee nuna, Intte ishai inttenaara xayikko, intte ta som77uwaa zaari be7ekketa giis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if I bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Israa7eeli, "Intte, Nuuyyo hara ishai de7ees giidi odidi ha metuwaa ta bolli aissi ehiidetii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: For except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second time.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin eti a, "He bitanee nubaanne nu so asaabaa mintti oichchiis. I nuna, Intte aawai ha77inne paxa de7ii? Intteyyo hara ishi de7ii? yaagidi oichchiis. Oichchin nuuni i oichchidoogaa ayyo zaarida. I nuna, Intte ishaa duge haa ehiite gaanabaa nuuni aibin eranee?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And their father Israel said unto them, If it must be so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spices, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai ba aawaa Israa7eela, "Nuunikka neenikka nu naatikka paxa de7ana malanne haiqqennan attana mala, na7aa tanaara yedda; nuuni sohuwaara baana.

English Sentences: And take double money in your hand; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks, carry it again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight:
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7aa ta waasetettan imma; aban tana oichcha; taani a neeyyo saro zaarada ehaana xayikko, ta de7o ubban ne qanggettai tana gakko!

English Sentences: Take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni gam77ibeennabaa gidiyaakko, hannoode naa77anttuwaa yaa gakkidi simmana shin" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may send away your other brother, and Benjamin. If I be bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan eta aawai Israa7eeli eta, "Hegaa gidikko, yaatite; he bitaniyaassi kushe genttiyoobaa ha biittan mokkidabaa ubbaappe lo77iyaabaa doorite; hegeenne balasaane giyo xaliyaa, eessaa, sawuwaa, karbbiyaanne tamire lauze giyo mittatu teeraa intte ogoruwan yeggidi ekki biite.

English Sentences: And the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin; and rose up, and went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ogoruwaa doonan simmida birai balettidabaa gidanau danddayiyo gishshau, biraakka naa77u kushe oottidi ekki biite.

English Sentences: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his house, Bring these men home, and slay, and make ready; for these men shall dine with me at noon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi intte ishaanne ekkidi, he bitaniyaakko eesuwan guyye biite.

English Sentences: And the man did as Joseph bade; and the man brought the men into Joseph's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: I hinkko intte ishaa yeddana mala, Biniyaaminne inttenaara yaana mala, Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai he bitanee intteyyo qarettanaadan ootto. Tana gidikko, ta naatuppe mela attikkonne attaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the men were afraid, because they were brought into Joseph's house; and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau he asati immiyoobatanne naa77u kushe biraanne qassi Biniyaamanne ekkidosona. Eti duge Gibxxe biidi, Yooseefa sintti shiiqidosona.

English Sentences: And they came near to the steward of Joseph's house, and they communed with him at the door of the house,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi Biniyaama etaara be7ido wode, ba keettaa halaqaa, "He asata ta soo ekkada ba; issi mehe shukkada giigissa; eti seeta gallassan laaxaa tanaara moosona" yaagidi azaziis.

English Sentences: And said, O sir, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin i Yooseefi ayyo yootidoogaadan he asata Yooseefa soo efiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asati Yooseefa soo biido gishshau, yayyidosona; eti, "Nuuni hagaa yiidoi koiro nu ogoruwaara simmidi biida biraa gishshaassa; i nuna wadhdhanau, ailletettan haaranaunne nu hareta ekkanau hanees" yaagidi qoppidosona.

English Sentences: And other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food: we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau eti Yooseefa keettaa pengge gakkidi, keettaa halaqaa haasayissidosona;

English Sentences: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta godau, nuuni koiro kattaa woommanau hagaa yiida;

English Sentences: And the man brought the men into Joseph's house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender.
Wolaitta Sentences: simmiiddi nuuni qammaa aqiyoosan ogoruwaa birshshidi, huuphiyan huuphiyan nu birai paccennan nu ogoruwaa doonan de7iyaagaa demmida; hegaa gishshau ha77i nuuni a guyye ekkidi yiida.

English Sentences: And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi nuuni kattaa woommanau hara biraakka ehiida. Nu biraa nu ogoruwaa ogoruwaa doonan ooni wottidaakkonne erokko" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And when Joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed themselves to him to the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i eta, "Hegee aikkobaa; yayyoppite! Intte Xoossai, intte aawaa Xoossai, intte ogoruwaa giddon intteyyo biraa immiis; taani intte biraa ekkaas" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, i Simoona etakko kessiis.

English Sentences: And he asked them of their welfare, and said, Is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?
Wolaitta Sentences: He bitanee he asata Yooseefa soo efiidi, eta tohuwaayyo haattaa ehin, bantta tohuwaa meecettidosona. Eta haretuyyo harqquwaa yeggiis.

English Sentences: And they answered, Thy servant our father is in good health, he is yet alive. And they bowed down their heads, and made obeisance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi seeta gallassi yin immanau, eti bantta immiyoobaa ayyo giigissidosona; aissi giikko, eti yan maanaagaa siyi uttidosona.

English Sentences: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother's son, and said, Is this your younger brother, of whom ye spake unto me? And he said, God be gracious unto thee, my son.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba soo gelido wode, eti soo ehiido bantta immiyoobaa son ayyo immidosona; eti a sinttan sa7aa gakkidi ziggidosona.

English Sentences: And Joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there.
Wolaitta Sentences: I eta sarotettaa oichchi simmidi, "Intte taayyo yootido intte aawai ceegai lo77oo? Ha77inne i paxa de7ii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he washed his face, and went out, and refrained himself, and said, Set on bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin eti, "Ee, ne ashkkarai, nu aawai ha77ikka paxa de7ees; i lo77o" yaagidi hokkidi ayyo ziggidosona.

English Sentences: And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that is an abomination unto the Egyptians.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba aayee na7aa Biniyaama be7ido wode eta, "Intte yootido wurssetta kaalo intte ishai hagee?" yaagiis. Qassi i Biniyaama, "Ta na7au, nena Xoossai anjjo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marvelled one at another.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi a ishai ayyo gomppan michchido gishshau, yeekkanau issisaa lauhu giis. I ba dumma qol77uwaa gelidi yan yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And he took and sent messes unto them from before him: but Benjamin's mess was five times so much as any of theirs. And they drank, and were merry with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba som77uwaa meecettiichchidoogaappe guyyiyan kiyidi, bana minttettidi, "Qumaa aattite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man's money in his sack's mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ayyo dumma, he ishanttayyo dumma, hegan aara miya Gibxxe asatuyyo dumma aattidosona; aissi giikko, Gibxxe asati Ibraawe asatuura issippe mookkona. Hegee Gibxxe biittaa asata sheneyiyaaba.

English Sentences: And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack's mouth of the youngest, and his corn money. And he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Yooseefa sinttan bairai ba bairatettaadan, kaaloi ba kaalotettaadan maaran uttidosona. Eti issoi issuwaa xeellidi, eta waati utissidaakko be7idi garamettidosona.

English Sentences: As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefa maaddaappe etau qumaa gishiyo wode, Biniyaamayyo gakkidaagee haratuugaappe ichchashu kushe darees; yaatin eti ufaittiiddi aara miidosonanne uyidosona.

English Sentences: And when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi ba keettaa halaqaa, "Neeni ha asatu ogoroi ekkiyoogaa keena kattaa etayyo kuntta; eta ubbaa biraanne eta ogoruwaa ogoruwaa doonan wotta;

English Sentences: Is not this it in which my lord drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.
Wolaitta Sentences: yaatada wurssetta kaaluwaa ogoruwaa doonan ta bira wanccaanne a kattaa biraa wotta" yaagidi azaziis; azazin i Yooseefi giidoogaadan oottiis.

English Sentences: And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7ai wonttin he asati bantta hareta ekkidi baanau moisettidosona.

English Sentences: And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words? God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing:
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti he katamaappe kiyidi haakki biichchennan de7ishin, Yooseefi ba keettaa halaqaa, "Dendda! Ha asatu geeduwaa kaalla; neeni eta gakkido wode eta, Intte aissi kehaa iitan zaaridetii?

English Sentences: Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord's house silver or gold?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagee ta godai uyiyoonne qassi xuurabaa demmiyo wanccaa gidennee? Hagee intte oottidobai hanttaaraba yaaga" yaagiis.

English Sentences: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord's bondmen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i eta geeduwaa gakkidi, ha giidoogaadankka etayyo yootiis.

English Sentences: And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti, "Ta godai hagaa mala qaala aissi haasayii? Hegaa malabaa oottiyoogee nuuppe ne ashkkaratuppe haakko!

English Sentences: Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni harai atto nu ogoruwaa doonaappe demmido biraa addaa Kanaane biittaappe guyye neeyyo zaari ehiida.

English Sentences: And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin's sack.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne godaa keettaappe nuuni worqqa woi bira waati wuuqqiyoonii? Ne ashkkaratu giddon he wanccai beettido uri haiqqo; qassi attida nuuni nu godaayyo aille gidana" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the city.
Wolaitta Sentences: I eta, "Hegaa gidikko lo77o; intte giidoogaadan gidobain; wanccaa ekkida ooninne ta aille gidana; hinkko attida intte boriyaappe saro attana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph's house; for he was yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, eti eesuwan bantta ogoruwaa ogoruwaa sa7an wottidi birshshidosona.

English Sentences: And Joseph said unto them, What deed is this that ye have done? wot ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine?
Wolaitta Sentences: Birshshin he halaqai ubbaappe bairatiyaagaa ogoruwaappe doommidi wurssetta kaaluwaagaa gakkanaassi koyiis; he wanccaanne Biniyaama ogoro giddoppe demmiis.

English Sentences: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegan eti azzanidi, bantta maayuwaa pooshshidosona; bantta ogoruwaa bantta haretun caanidi, guyye katamaa simmidosona.

English Sentences: And he said, God forbid that I should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yihudai ba ishanttuura Yooseefakko geliyo wode, Yooseefi son de7ees; eti a sinttan sa7an gufannidosona.

English Sentences: Then Judah came near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord's ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant: for thou art even as Pharaoh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi eta, "Intte aiba palabaa oottidetii? Ta mala asi xuurabaa demmiyoogaa erekketiiyye?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yihudai, "Ta godaayyo nuuni ai gaanee? Nuuni ai haasayanee? Woikko nuuni xillo gidiyoogaa waati bessanee? Xoossai ne ailletu mooruwaa qonccissirggiis. Simmi nuunikka he wanccai appe beettidoogeekka ta godaayyo aille gidida" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Yooseefi, "Hagaa malabaa oottiyoogee taappe haakko; ta wanccai appe beettido bitaniyaa xalaalai ta aille gidana. Hinkko intte intte aawaakko guyye saro simmite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yihudai akko shiiqidi a, "Ta godau, taani issi qaala haasayana mala nena woossais; tana ne ailliyaa hanqqettoppa; aissi giikko, neeni kawuwaa mala.

English Sentences: And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ta godai nuna ne ailleta, Intteyyo aawi de7iiyye woikko ishi de7ii? yaagada oichchadasa.

English Sentences: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuninne, Nuuyyo ceeggida aawai de7ees; i ceeggiichchidi yelido kaalo na7aikka de7ees; he na7aa ishai haiqqiis; ba aayeeyyo issi a xalaalai attiis; a aawai a siiqees yaagida.

English Sentences: And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni ne ailleta, Taani a be7ana mala taayyo ehiite yaagadasa.

English Sentences: And our father said, Go again, and buy us a little food.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin nuuni ta godaa, He na7ai ba aawaappe shaahettanau danddayenna; shaahettikko a aawai haiqqana yaagida.

English Sentences: And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man's face, except our youngest brother be with us.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni ne ailleta, Intte kaalo ishai inttenaara duge yaana xayikko, naa77antto ta som77uwaa be7ekketa yaagadasa.

English Sentences: And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons:
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni ne ailliyaa nu aawaakko simmidi biido wode, ta godai giidoogaa ayyo yootida.

English Sentences: And the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in pieces; and I saw him not since:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yootin nu aawai, Guyye biidi amarida katta woommite yaagin,

English Sentences: And if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him, ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
Wolaitta Sentences: nuuni a, Nuuni nu kaalo ishai nunaara biikkoppe attin, duge baanau danddayokko; aissi giikko, nu ishai kaaloi nunaara beennabaa gidikko, nuuni he bitaniyaa som77uwaa be7anau danddayokko yaagida.

English Sentences: Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad's life;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaagin nu aawai ne aillee nuna, Ta keettaayyiyaa Raaheela taayyo naa77u attuma naata yelidoogaa intte ereeta;

English Sentences: It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.
Wolaitta Sentences: etappe issoi taappe shaahettidi bin, "Tumu a do7i zaazzidi miis" yaagaas; hachchi gakkanaassikka taani a be7abeikke.

English Sentences: For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame to my father for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagaa qassi intte taappe shaakki efin, iitabi a gakkikko, intte ta puuluntta huuphiyaa azzanuwaara duufuwan yeggana yaagiis.

English Sentences: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, ha77i taani guyye ne ailliyaa ta aawaakko biyo wode,

English Sentences: For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father.
Wolaitta Sentences: ta aawai, na7aa ba shemppuwaadan siiqiyaagee, na7ai nunaara bainnaagaa be7ikko haiqqi aggana. Nuuni ne ailleti nu aawaa puuluntta huuphiyaa azzanuwaara duufuwan yeggoos.

English Sentences: Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him; and he cried, Cause every man to go out from me. And there stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ne aillee na7aa ta waasetettan ekkaas; taani a, Ta aawau, taani a neeyyo saro zaarada ehaana xayikko, ta de7uwaa ubban ne qanggettai tana gakko! yaaga wottaas.

English Sentences: And he wept aloud: and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaanido gishshau, taani ne aillee ta godaayyo na7aa gishshaa ailletada, hagan attin, na7ai ba ishanttuura guyye simmo.

English Sentences: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I am Joseph; doth my father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7ai bainnan taani waanada guyye ta aawaakko simmanee? CHii, tana ta aawai seelettana seelaa bessoppa" yaagiis.
